title: Microsoft Teams - Calling Support between Teams and Skype Consumer
description:
This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for 1:1 Skype Consumer Calls. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Stream: Public anonymous external video sharing
description: Allow individual videos in Microsoft Stream to be marked for external public access allowing the video to be embeded in a public website. Anyone in the world can view these external videos without a login. Stream admins will be able to control if this feature is enabled and who within the organization can make videos publicly available.

title: Removal of Safe Links Re-write for Outlook Client(s)
description: For users using Outlook, Safe Links will render the original URL and not show the re-written URL.  This will enable users to view the original link that arrives in an email.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Enjoy animated GIFs in email
description: Emails take on more character with animated GIFs supported in messages you create or receive.

title: Additional Customer Lockbox Approver Role
description: Additional approver roles in Customer Lockbox, extends Customer Lockbox approvers to non-tenant admins within their organization. With this feature, customers can designate specific personnel within their organization to be approvers to customer data during service operations by Microsoft.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Get suggestions for Calendar meeting and appointment locations
description: Start typing a meeting room or venue for your appointment or meeting. Outlook will look for matching locations.

title: Email sender rewriting of unverified domains for EOP relayed emails
description: In the past, emails sent from customers' on-premises servers and devices could have a sender email address for a domain that had not been verified as theirs. This opens up the possibility for abuse and spoofing of unowned domains. Customers should only send emails for domains they own. Domain ownership is verified for Office 365 tenants by using the Accepted Domains list. That list of domains can be viewed by going to the Mail Flow section in the Exchange Admin Center. Moving forward, any emails sent with an unverified domain in the Mail From field will have that email address changed. This applies to emails from customers' own email servers (also called "on-premises servers"), devices such as multi-function printers, and applications that send out emails that all make use of an Office 365 connector. The Mail From field is the sender address that email servers use to check who sent the email. This is different to the From header which is shown in email clients for recipients to see who sent it. Normally, the Mail From field and From header have the same email address, but not always. The From header will not be rewritten by this change. Problem email addresses in the Mail From field will be rewritten to use the default domain of the tenant together and any non-delivery reports will be directed back to customers' tenants to the email address bounces@contoso.com where contoso.com is the default domain of the tenant.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Set text size for reading emails
description: Set your preference for Zoom percentage to adjust the test size for ease of access to reading emails.

title: Service Health Dashboard Update: Email Notifications (GA)
description: Generally available enhancement to the Service Health Dashboard in the Office 365 admin center: Stay informed through your preferred channel—The new Service health dashboard will enable you to sign up for notifications via email so that you can monitor the service and track issues through the channel you prefer.

title: Outlook on the web: Third party storage services
description: Outlook on the web will provide Office 365 admins the ability to allow their users to connect to third party storage services and share and attach files right from Outlook on the web.

title: Office Roadmap Filter Feature Improvements
description: In efforts to make the roadmap the go-to resource for customers, we are currently improving the functionality of the filter feature, which will be unavailable in the meantime. Please use the search bar to continue using the Office roadmap to keep up-to-date with new features.

title: Microsoft Stream: Mobile apps
description: iOS and Android app for Microsoft Stream for on the go video - now watch videos online or offline - right from your mobile!

title: Outlook for Mac:  Shared calendar improvements
description: Introducing a new service backed model for sharing calendars with other Office 365 subscribers that improves performance and reliability and keeps all calendars in sync.

title: Outlook for Mac:  Teams Integration
description: Schedule a Teams meeting and enable one click join for attendees.

title: Outlook for iOS:  Block links to external images
description: Set up your account to block links in emails to external images.

title: Outlook for iOS: View group events
description: Users will be able to view upcoming group events directly from the group's contact card.

title: Outlook for iOS:  Favorite people
description: Designate people as favorites so they are quickly and easily visible Outlook for iOS and soon in other Outlook endpoints (e.g. Outlook on the web)

title: Outlook for Android: Favorite people
description: Designate people as favorites so they are quickly and easily visible in Outlook for Android and soon in other Outlook endpoints (e.g. Outlook on the web)

title: Outlook for Android:  Monthly Calendar view
description: View your Outlook Calendar in a full month format in addition to Agenda, Day and 3-Day.

title: Microsoft Secure Score API Update
description: Secure Score will update its API to support new fields and provide more granular information.

title: Microsoft Secure Score support for delegated administrators
description: Secure Score will allow users with delegated administrator rights to access score data.

title: SharePoint and Teams: connect site to a Team in one click
description: If you’re group-connected team site is not connected to a chat-based hub for teamwork, then it’s just one click of the new Connect to Teams button in bottom-left corner of your site that gets you one.

title: SharePoint news: save for later (Web)
description: You can now save news articles to catch up on later, right from the Web interface of your intranet - as you can today on mobile. Simply click Save for later from the bottom of the news article and it gets added to your saved list, accessible from the Me tab in the SharePoint mobile app. You will also be able to access your saved list from SharePoint home.

title: SharePoint news: @mentions in comments
description: Similar to Outlook, it is now possible to @mention someone who has access to the news article within its comments and they will be notified and brought into the discussion. Did we @mention to you that there’s no easier way to loop someone in?

title: SharePoint organizational news: deem specific sites as main news sites
description: As news rolls up to people across their SharePoint home in Office 365, or via the news tab in their SharePoint mobile all, the news that comes from “organizational news source” sites will get special visual treatment bubbling up to the top of one’s view.

title: SharePoint organizational news: page approval
description: Establish a new and custom Microsoft Flow flows for approval. Simply name your flow, add the person who will approve your page, save it as a draft, submit for approval. Once approved, the page status gets updated to “published” and is visible to your intended readers. Approvals for news posts work out of the box thanks to integration with Microsoft Flow. Of which, you, too, can further customize your workflow to meet the needs of your specific approval process. Kick off inline review for pages and news. Click the "Submit for approval" button and enter your reviewers email address.

title: SharePoint hub sites: add rich color to header
description: You will now have choices beyond the color white. It’ll be easier and more flexible to adhere to your preferred company theme and brand colors across more aspects of the sites and pages.

title: SharePoint hub sites: approvals for site association
description: A flexible approval process further empowers hub site owners and site owners to make requests and programmatically adapt to changes within their growing, dynamic intranet.

title: SharePoint organizational news: choose site sources
description: News web parts filter news from a variety of source sites, filtering based on content you want to show, in the layout you find most conducive to your overall site vision.

title: Alert Policies in Office 365 Security & Compliance Center available to E1/ E3 customers
description:
You can use the new alert policy and alert dashboard tools in the Office 365 Security & Compliance Center to create alert policies and then view the alerts that are generated when users perform activities that match the conditions of an alert policy. 
In this release, 3 system default alert policies will be visible and on by default for E1/E3 customers once the feature is rolled out, including Elevation of Exchange admin privilege, Creation of forwarding/redirect rules and Messages that have been delayed; With E5 subscription, or E1/E3 with Threat intelligence or Advanced Compliance add-ons, the experience of alert policies remains the same.

title: SharePoint: select a language at site creation
description: It will be possible for site owners to select a language for their site at the time they create it during the self-service site creation process from SharePoint home in Office 365; using the  "Create site" button. Previously this was only available to do by admins from the SharePoint admin center in Office 365. There are approximately 50 languages available in the service to choose from. You select this at the same time you choose the site design, name, description and classification.

title: Live event broadcasts in Microsoft Stream
description: Schedule and host live event broadcasts in Microsoft Stream.

title: SharePoint: modern team site if not group enabled
description: People can create new team sites when they click "Create site" from the SharePoint home in Office 365. However, if a person is not enabled to create Office 365 Groups, they would be routed to create a subsite within a designated site collection, and it would not have modern team site features. With this update, people who are not deemed able to create Office 365 Groups will now be able to create modern SharePoint team sites that are not connected to an Office 365 group, though do have the modern user experiences for the home page, lists, libraries - and it is its own standalone site collection. This, too, applies to when a person creates a subsite, it, too, would use the modern design - if subsite creation is not disabled.

title: Create Power BI reports from Excel in SharePoint
description: You will be able to create Power BI reports from Excel files and CSV files stored in SharePoint libraries and OneDrive folders.

title: Correcting Shared Mailbox Provisioning and Sizing Logic
description:
We are correcting how shared (and resource) mailboxes are created in Exchange Online.
As per our documentation, shared and resource mailboxes in Exchange Online should be created with the size of 50GB and if a larger size is desired, a license should be assigned to the mailbox. For some time the Exchange Online system would create both new shared and resource mailboxes with a default size of 100GB even if a license was not assigned. This is now being corrected to match the documented behavior.

title: Exchange Hybrid Configuration Wizard - Organization Config Transfer Phase 1
description:
The Exchange Hybrid Configuration Wizard will detect and copy specific policy and configuration objects from On-Premises to Exchange Online to reduce administrative overhead when setting up a new tenant. The objects evaluated in this phase are; Retention Policy, Retention Policy Tags, OWA Mailbox Policy, Mobile Device Mailbox Policy, Active Sync Mailbox Policy.  

This phase will only copy and create non-matching objects, i.e. if Policy A exists in both On-Premises and Cloud it will not be copied. If Policy B exists only in On-Premises it will be copied.

title: Updates to secure external sharing experience for files and folders
description: We are updating our one-time passcode secure external sharing experience for files and folders in OneDrive and SharePoint Online. With this change, external recipients who also use Office 365 in their organization will be asked to sign in to their Office 365 account. This process will create a Guest account in your organization's directory and can be managed by you in the same way that all other Guest accounts can be managed today. This update will also allow external recipients that also use Office 365 in their organization to open Office documents using the Office desktop apps.

title: Office 365 Message Encryption: Admin control now available for Office attachments
description: Administrators can now control whether Office attachments are protected for recipients outside of Office 365 when the Encrypt-Only template is used.  This was a key ask from Office 365 Message Encryption customers and is now available as a tenant-level setting.

title: Support for Universal Outlook protocol in Client Access Rules
description: This update to Client Access Rules allows administrators to control access to Exchange Online for clients that use the Universal Outlook protocol (e.g., the Windows 10 Mail app). UniversalOutlook will become a valid value for the AnyOfProtocols and ExceptAnyOfProtocols parameters in Client Access Rules

title: SharePoint organizational news: hub site news web part update
description: The unique ‘hub layout’ in the news web part for SharePoint hub sites will provide additional capabilities like pinning news articles, a new compact layout, and carousel support. Choose from a new variety of news layouts to best promote your news on your pages.

title: SharePoint web part: Image (update)
description: Enhance your images with hyperlinks and allow authors to overlay text on images.

title: SharePoint mobile: notifications on page likes
description: You’ll receive a notification when someone clicks the Like button on a news article you published. How do you like that? If you do like it, you’ll be notified.

title: Enhanced list-library view web part
description: The updated list-library view web parts allow full fidelity to the immersive full page experience, with support for sorting, command bar actions, and column formatting.

title: Modern list templates for issues, contacts and datasheet
description:
The following list templates now have modern UI support:  Issue Tracking, Contacts,  Custom List in Datasheet View New and existing lists created using one of these templates will now appear in modern UI by default. 

Additionally, the native UI now supports multi-line text fields with the "Append Changes to Existing Text" setting enabled. Lists that contain this field type will no longer fall back to classic mode to accommodate these fields.

title: Update to file handling in libraries with required metadata
description: When a new file is created (using Office Online) in a library by clicking the New button and entering the required metadata, the file will no longer be checked out automatically to the user who created it.  This allows other people to see the file even if required metadata has not been specified yet.

title: SharePoint hub sites: site scripting during site association
description:
Once a site gets associated to a hub site, it not only inherits the theme of the hub site, it can now be further configured using powerful site scripting methods to enforce permissions, shared metadata, preferred content management, brand elements and policies.
Program site scripts to run automatically when a site is associated to a hub site to adhere to preferences for that family of sites.

title: SharePoint web parts: Document library and lists updates
description: It’s even easier to engage with documents and lists on a modern page with tile view and drag and drop upload. Now with custom views, grouping, sorting, filtering, column formatting, and drag & drop upload.

title: SharePoint and Teams: folder in site visibly connected to channel
description: Now it’s easy to tell which folders within your library have an associated Teams channel & chat associated to it – right from within the SharePoint user interface.

title: SharePoint and Teams: pick news articles and lists as tabs in teams
description: When you add a tab in Teams, you can tab between available lists, pages and news items to quickly bring them into your hub for teamwork. They’re your tabs, use them.

title: SharePoint: new Planner integration
description: This is Planner for the team as a full-page app. Simply click New  Plan, and start managing team tasks right inside the SharePoint user experience. Add a Planner Plan from within SharePoint in Office 365 (click New  Plan).

title: Microsoft Bookings - online payments for E3, E5, A3, and A5 subscriptions
description: Bookings will now allow users to request an online payment in order for a customer to complete booking an appointment. Feature will be off-by-default and payment/banking information can only be set-up or modified by an Office 365 admin.

title: Data Privacy tab in the Security & Compliance Center
description: With the new Data Privacy tab in the Office 365 Security and Compliance Center you now have a home for privacy and GDPR related tasks in Office 365. the Data privacy tab provides access to the GDPR dashboard with tools, resources and insights available as well as the Data Subject Request experience for Office 365 content. Create a DSR, execute your search, refine your search with conditions and labels, and export the results.

title: Updates to terminology used for Office 365 Groups, Distribution Lists, and Security Groups
description: We’re updating terminology used across Office Admin Center, Exchange Admin Center, and Azure Admin Portal to provide a more consistent experience when interacting with groups and distribution lists. In the Office Admin Center and the Exchange Admin Center, the ‘Group Type’ column will now include values of ‘Office 365’, ‘Mail-enabled security’, ‘Distribution list’, and ‘Security’. The concept of ‘Distribution Group’ will now be referred to as ‘Distribution List’ throughout experiences such as group creation, edit, and upgrade.

title: Index large lists and complex field types
description: Index and optimize large lists and complex field types like lookup, people and taxonomy

title: Page management
description: Build pages and news with templates, classifications, targeting and workflow

title: Smart people picker(Web only)
description: Users sharing OneDrive and SharePoint files and folders will get intelligent graph-based suggestions when entering recipients in the To line.

title: Microsoft Cloud App Security – Conditional Access App Control
description:
A unique
integration with Azure AD Conditional Access to enable real-time control of
risky user sessions based on preset conditions, when they are accessing your
organization’s SaaS apps.  This
functionality utilizes a reverse proxy architecture.

title: File +  Folder activity
description: Users are able to see an improved view of the activity happening around their files including edits and shares in the details pane in OneDrive and SharePoint.

title: File activity in list view
description: Users can see the activities happening on their files from the files view, helping them hone in on the files that are most important to them.

title: Better manage permissions UI
description: Making it easy for the users to understand who has access to the content and manage it appropriately

title: SharePoint web part: Weather
description: Site owners and members will now be able to show the current weather on their site home page, within sub pages and/or within a news article on team sites, communication sites and hub sites. Simply add the web part to your page or news, add a location and select from Fahrenheit or Celsius (°F or °C). The web part pulls up-to-date information from MSN Weather.

title: Label Activity Explorer Dashboard in Office 365 Data Governance
description: Use the Label Activity Explorer Dashboard to gain insights into labels usage in your organization, including top labels, ratio of user vs auto-applied and more.

title: Planner: Task commenting updates
description: Today, group members who follow the group in their inbox receive all group emails in their personal inbox, including all Planner task comments.  With this change, Planner comments will no longer be delivered to a personal inbox, even when following group members are following the group.  Group members will still receive tasks comments in their inbox for tasks that they have commented on.

title: New Scan Experience(ODB+ODC)
description: We will make the built-in scan functionality in OneDrive Mobile even easier to use by moving the feature from the +menu to its own standalone icon on the bottom of the OneDrive menu

title: Password protected links (ODB)
description: Users will be able to set a custom password when sharing a link, to make sure that only people who know the password can open it.

title: Tenant branding of sharing emails
description: Tenant admins will be able to add branding to sharing emails so they look more trustworthy to recipients.

title: Updated Shared with me on Mobile
description: Updated list of files based on a new API including who shared the item with you.

title: Outlook on the web - bill payment events on calendar
description:
Outlook will now automatically create events in your calendar for statements with payment due dates and send you an email reminder two days before the due date.
This complements our work with flights, hotels, cars, and packages.
Automatically adding the due date to your calendar will be set to "off by default".

title: SharePoint pages and news: custom metadata columns
description: Allow customers to add custom metadata to modern SharePoint pages and news articles. This gives you the ability to create prescriptive information architecture and solutions that use the pages/news' metadata for dynamic grouping and organization.

title: Outlook on the web - read/unread emails inside groups
description: We are changing the behavior of how emails appear, when you navigate to a group in Outlook to make it similar to how your inbox or any other folder behave. With his change, users will have the capability to mark any email in groups as read or unread. The read state of an email inside a group would be maintained across sessions to enable users to leave a group and continue from where they left off.

title: Outlook for iOS: Access group notebook
description: Users will be able to launch the OneNote app from Outlook to access groups notebooks.

title: Outlook for Android: Access group notebook
description: Users will be able to launch the OneNote app from Outlook to access groups notebooks.

title: Outlook for Android:  Delete contacts
description: With Sync Contacts on, deleting contacts in Outlook automatically removes them from the built in contacts app on your device.

title: Outlook for Android:  Do Not Disturb settings
description: Set time and work/personal situations when you do don't want email notifications and reminders.

title: Changes to the legacy SMTP Authenticated Submission client protocol in Exchange Online
description:
SMTP Authenticated Submission (also known as SMTP Client Submission) protocol allows clients and apps using smtp.office365.com to send a message from an Office 365 hosted mailbox. Changes to the protocol are being rolled out may affect customers who send using this protocol. 
Moving forward, sent emails will now be stored in the Sent Items folder of the mailbox as is the case with other client protocols.
Also, a maximum of three active concurrent connections submitting emails to our service per mailbox will be allowed. Additional connections will be rejected with the error: 4.3.2 STOREDRV.ClientSubmit; sender thread limit exceeded. Given that throttling is already in place to limit submissions to 30 per minute, this additional limit will not affect most of our customers.

title: Click to Run installer can now remove old MSI Office installations
description: Office apps installed via MSI (Windows Installer) and Click to Run (C2R) on the same computer is not a supported scenario.  IT Pros and end users needed to first uninstall MSI Office apps, before installing C2R.  Starting with the March Semi-Annual Channel - Targeted (SAC-T) release of Office 365 ProPlus, the C2R installer can be scripted to automatically remove old MSI Office apps prior to installing Office 365 ProPlus.

title: Microsoft Stream: Channel embed code
description: Ability to get an embed code for an entire Microsoft Stream channel and it's videos, to display the  channel outside of Stream on another page. (Similar to embedding a video, but for an entire channel).

title: Microsoft Teams - Consultative Transfer
description: Consultative Transfer allows the person transferring the call to first confirm with the call destination before completing the transfer. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018

title: Microsoft Stream: Support for GDPR
description: Support for actions on both invisible and visible data in Microsoft Stream to comply with GDPR regulations.

title: Microsoft Stream: Include Stream actions in O365 audit logs
description: Actions taken against videos in Microsoft Stream to show up in the Office 365 audit logs.

title: Microsoft Stream: Recorded Microsoft Teams meeting automatically uploaded to Stream
description: When you record a meeting in Microsoft Teams it will be automatically uploaded to Microst Stream. Anyone who missed the meeting can get up to speed by reviewing the meeting recording by watching the video, searching the transcript, or jumping to where specific faces appeared.

title: Outlook for iOS: Access group files
description: Users will be able to access files shared with Groups which include email attachments and SharePoint files.

title: Outlook for Android: Access group files
description: Users will be able to access files shared with Groups which include email attachments and SharePoint files.

title: Message Center Reader Role
description: The new Message center Reader role will allow admins to set users in their organization to only get access to Message Center within the admin portal. The MC Reader role permits users to read Message Center posts and share them, set their preferences, and receive email communications from Message center.

title: Microsoft Teams - User-Level Meeting Policy
description:
This is one of the SfB IT Pro meetings capabilities coming to Teams. This feature provides the ability for the tenant to define a Meetings Policy and apply that policy on a per user basis. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Skype Room Systems Support for Teams Meetings
description:
This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Enable Skype Room Systems to natively join Teams meetings. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Surface Hub Support for Teams Meetings
description:
This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Enable Surface Hub to natively join Teams meetings. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Enable VTC Interop Services
description:
This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams to enable companies to use VTC Interop services from Microsoft partners with Microsoft Teams. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Trio One-Touch Teams Meetings Join
description:
This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Enable Trio for One Touch Teams Meetings Join. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - eDiscovery Enhancements (Meetings)
description:
This is one of the SfB IT Pro meetings capabilities coming to Teams and provides a number of eDiscovery enhancements. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Support for existing certified SIP Phones
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for a range of SIP phones. As we get closer to release, we will specify which phones are supported. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018

title: Microsoft Teams - PowerPoint Load and Share
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Enable meeting attendees to upload and present PowerPoint slides. Other attendees can browse forward and back through the deck independently of the presenter. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Whiteboard and Meeting notes
description: This is one of the SfB meetings capabilities coming to Teams. Allows for a whiteboard to be added to a meeting and support for meeting notes. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Hybrid Connection to Teams
description:
This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Enable customers to use their on-premises phone trunks with Office 365 and Microsoft Teams for calling. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Escalate 1:1 Chat/Call to Multiparty (3 or more people)
description:
This is one of the SfB capabilities coming to Teams. Escalation enables the adding of people to chat, adding video, sharing, and turning your calling into a meeting. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Support for features for USB Devices
description:
This is one of the SfB basic supporting capabilities coming to Teams. the USB human interface device class (USB HID class) is a part of the specification for peripherals. This work enables Teams to recognize common signals from USB devices. Examples include but not limited to are Mute and Volume control. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - 1:1 to group call escalation with Teams, Skype for Business and PSTN participants
description:
This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for 1:1 to group call escalation with Teams, Skype for Business and PSTN participants. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Broadcast Meetings
description:
This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams to enable large townhall-style meetings with Microsoft Teams. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Cloud Recording
description:
This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Record and playback meetings in the cloud. This feature is
targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Large Meeting Support (~250)
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. This will increase the number of supported attendees in a Teams meeting to a maximum of 250. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - PSTN Fallback
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. This feature supports having a meeting call an attendee via traditional voice to improve call quality. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Lobby for PSTN callers
description: This is one of the SfB voice capabilities coming to Teams. Similar to meetings, lobby support will be enabled for PSTN Callers. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Outlook meeting schedule from other platforms (OWA, OLK mobile)
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. This feature will enable meeting scheduling on mobile, web, and Mac platforms. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Federated Meetings
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Enable federated meeting joins from external companies using a user's ID. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Sender rewriting scheme for forwarded emails from Office 365
description:
To combat email abuse, new authentication mechanisms, such as SPF, DKIM, and DMARC, are being used to combat the spoofing of domains by spammers. These mechanisms, however, are not compatible with the way emails have been forwarded from Office 365 to forward addresses set up for hosted mailboxes. More and more, recipient email servers are rejecting forwarded emails coming from Office 365 as the sender address is not for a domain Office 365 is allowed to send as. 

To fix this issue, a sender rewriting scheme is being rolled out in Office 365 that will change the sender email address to use the domain of the tenant whose mailbox is forwarding the message. This will avoid the rejections taking place by some email servers with strict settings for their SPF checks. Specifically, the Mail From field that email servers use to determine the sender email address will be rewritten. The separate From header which contains the sender address that is shown to recipients in their email client will not be changed. If any forwarded emails fail to be delivered to the forwarded address, the non-delivery responses will be sent to the original sender of the email which has always been the case

title: Microsoft Teams - Out of Office Support
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. This feature will allow users to set an Out of Office status and share that with others. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Boss and Delegate Support
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for Boss Delegation allowing other to answer calling on behalf of others. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Call Queues
description: This is one of the SfB IT Pro calling capabilities coming to Teams. Call Queues provides an organizational greeting, hold music, can redirect calls, and settings for queue size, time out and other handling options. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Distinctive Ring
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Distinctive Ring allows the establishment of additional telephone numbers on the same line as an existing number, each number ringing with a distinctive ringing pattern. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Do not Disturb breakthrough
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Do not disturb breakthrough allows users to designate who can breakthrough their DND such as their team members. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Forward to Group
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. This allows for a call to be forwarded to a group. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Microsoft Teams - Organizational Auto-Attendant
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. This feature provides support for the transfer of callers to the extension of a user or department without the intervention of a receptionist or an operator. This feature is targeted for availability by Q2 CY 2018.

title: Outlook for Mac: Create and Manage Groups
description: We're bringing group creation and member management to Outlook for Mac. Users will be able to create a group and add/remove group members. This feature respects company policies set by administrators.

title: Desktop Notifications for sharing
description: With the new desktop notifications users will be allowed to quickly see when files that have been shared by them were opened or changed by the team

title: Service Health Dashboard Update: Support for multi-geo tenants
description: We're adding enhancements to the Service Health Dashboard in the Office 365 admin center: Customers who are using the Multi-Geo Capabilities in Office 365 will be able to see which regions are impacted by a service incident.

title: SharePoint - Web part: PowerApps
description: Add any PowerApp to any SharePoint modern page, regardless of data source

title: Outlook for iOS: Draft sync
description: Sync drafts emails between different versions of Outlook. You can start a message in one place and finish and send in another.

title: Outlook for Android: Quick Reply
description: Reply to emails more quickly with a new reply field offering a simpler experience and the ability to scroll up and re-read the message thread while composing your reply.

title: File/folder activities (OneDrive web only)
description: Users will be able to stay up to date with what is happening on their files and folders. Activities will be available in the Details pane for each item.

title: Office 365 Usage Analytics GA
description: Office 365 Usage Analytics - formerly known as adoption content pack in Power BI - enables admin to visualize and analyze their organization’s Office 365 usage data, create custom reports, and share the insights – pivoting by attributes available in Azure Active Directory such as location and department.  With these insights, admins can drive more targeted end user training and communication that will help them transform how their organization communicates and collaborates, enabling a truly modern workplace.

title: Microsoft Bookings - online payments for Business Premium subscriptions
description: Bookings will now allow users to request an online payment in order for a customer to complete booking an appointment. Feature will be off-by-default and payment/banking information can only be set-up or modified by an Office 365 admin.

title: Outlook for Windows:  LinkedIn integration
description: Connect your Microsoft 365 account with LinkedIn and quickly have access to the LinkedIn profile of the people you work with daily in Outlook.

title: Outlook on the web: Attach OneDrive Consumer Files
description: This allows you to access files stored on Microsoft's OneDrive for Consumer cloud storage when sending attachments in Outlook on the web. This feature will come with an admin switch for companies that do not want to give users access to personal file storage.

title: Recover deleted Office 365 Group from the Exchange admin center
description: If an Office 365 Group is deleted, tenant administrators will have the ability to restore the group from the Exchange admin center. Note you can also restore an Office 365 Group using PowerShell cmdlets.

title: Outlook on the web: Share Calendar Availability
description: Helps you easily provide available times for a possible meeting within an email.  Within an email reply, can bring up your calendar and graphically drag and drop slots you currently have available on your calendar.  These are then shown as a availability card in your email.

title: BigInt datatype support
description: Add support for 64-bit numbers (BigInt) as a new Access/Ace Datatype. Users will be able to use the new Large Number datatype and import/link to a SQL Database (via ODBC) that has BigInt columns.

title: External users support for Project Online
description: Project Online is going to support sharing Project sites with external users and also provide an ability to license external users for appropriate participation in project management workflows.

title: Outlook on the web: New First Run Experience
description: First run experience (FRE) for on-boarding new Outlook on the web users.  Walks user through set up their preferred signature and theme.

title: Outlook on the web: Sweep Enhancements
description: Outlook on the web has long provided the ability to perform Sweep actions on a per user basis. We are adding the ability to select multiple users by message and perform any Sweep action from the Sweep dropdown on the multiple selection.

title: FastTrack for Skype for Business Cloud Voice Services
description: As part of FastTrack engagements, FastTrack will provide customers with guidance, content, and best practices on how to plan, deploy, and adopt Cloud Voice successfully. FastTrack best practices, tools, and resources associated with Skype for Business are based on the Skype Operations Framework. While FastTrack has provided onboarding and adoption guidance to this point, this update provides expanded guidance for voice services. FastTrack Provides guidance to: Overview the Skype Operations Framework (SOF):  Capture business requirements, define architecture and approach, assess readiness, undertake remediation and preparation.

title: Project Online: OData improvements to include timestamps for project entities
description: Project Online OData service will now include modification dates for several entities such as tasks, resources, engagements, assignments etc.  These changes will provide better insights into when something inside your projects gets updated, thereby enabling richer reports.

title: Conditional access policies for location and apps
description: These policies allow IT and security administrators to establish broad tenant policies, limiting access when needed to just a specific corporate network or location – and preventing access from unknown locations.

title: MyAnalytics: weekly digest email
description: MyAnalytics will start to send users a weekly digest email of insights derived from their MyAnalytics dashboard. This digest will include progress against goals, recommendations for how to improve progress and summary insights about the past week.

title: Improved Consultative Transfer Workflow
description: A new, streamlined workflow for conferring with an executive before transferring a call. Assistants can click a new “Consult” button from the call window, choose who to consult with, perform a consultation and complete the transfer in a single window.

title: New and Improved Skype for Business Windows Notifications
description: This introduces a more modern look and feel for Skype for Business Windows notifications and makes it easier to take quick action on incoming calls / requests.

title: Office 365 Groups: Invite To Join
description:
We are introducing a new feature for group users to create an invite link for any group they are part of and share it with others. The invite link can be emailed or can be copied and pasted to any other channels. The users who click on this invite link will join the public group automatically and will join private groups on approval from group owners.
  This feature is available only on Outlook on Web.

title: Find and upgrade eligible Exchange Online Distribution Lists
description: Groups in Outlook are more than a distribution list - even new members get access to past conversations and attachment. Using the Exchange Admin Console, tenant administrators can easily identify all DLs that can be upgraded to Office 365 Groups, and upgrade one or  more eligible DLs at the same time. Exchange cmdlets will also be available for this purpose.

title: Calendar events for groups in Outlook
description: Users will receive calendar invitations for the Office 365 Groups they've joined, directly in their inbox.  This will replace the current behavior, which required users to manually add groups in Outlook events to their individual calendars.

title: Simplified sharing from OneDrive for Business from the web
description: We have updated the sharing experience  for OneDrive. This new sharing interface simplifies the sharing of personal content internally (within your organization) or externally, as well as making flow of emailing links to colleagues and guests and copying links to the clipboard super easy.

title: Delve - personalized search
description: The search experience within Delve - when you start typing in the upper-left hand search text box - will become a more personalized; based more on the relevancy of who you work with and what you are working on. There are two main phases of this personalized search, recovery and discovery. Recovery starts as you click into the search text box, before even typing anything, you will see search items based on your most recent work. And as you type, you'll see a refinement of recent work items related to the keyword(s) you used. Once you hit return, you enter the discovery side of search across Office 365. This is where you are now searching content, people, sites from throughout your enterprise – presented to you in order based on what is most relevant to you.

title: Delve - new entry point: delve.office.com
description: Get to Delve more easily by typing in the new, easy-to-remember entry point to content & people search and discovery; type delve.office.com, sign in and you're into the new Delve experience. Users will now get a more personalized view of content trending around their work social sphere, that now includes documents from Office 365 Groups, modern attachments from Outlook, and more.

title: SharePoint Online - personalized news on the SharePoint home page in Office 365
description: Today, you have an aggregate, personalized view of team news coming to you on your SharePoint mobile app - team news that comes from across all your active team sites. You now will be able to view this same aggregate of news article at the top of the SharePoint home page in Office 365 (where you land when you click the "SharePoint" tile within the Office 365 app launcher). This makes the SharePoint home in Office 365 the best place to see what's happening in all the sites and portals you interact with and track, perform enterprise-wide search, and now consume all the news happening around you.

title: Flow Integration for Document Libraries
description: We are enhancing the connector from SharePoint to PowerApps and Flow.  We are adding write support for people, choice, and lookup columns for Microsoft Flow, and supporting connections to lists other than custom lists. Microsoft Flow will also be able to connect to SharePoint document libraries and use/set metadata columns.

title: Mailbox Plan Enhancements
description: Mailbox Plans allows the administrator to customize and pre-configure several mailbox properties that will be set on a mailbox at the time it is created. This feature extends the set of properties that are allowed to be configured.

title: Integrated modern file copy for 500MB files
description: Expanded scope of modern file copy for SharePoint and OneDrive for Business to cover files up to 500MB total size; copy in place; and support multiple file download to a single Zip file.

title: SharePoint mobile app for Android - team news rollup
description: If you use the SharePoint mobile app on Android, you will soon get the mobile experience of team news. When you tap the News tab, you will see a list of aggregated news using the intelligence of the Microsoft Graph from the sites you work in, the sites you follow and the sites your colleagues work in. SharePoint mobile on Android gives you one place to catch up on the news from across your intranet. That’s your news in your pocket!

title: SharePoint home page in Office 365 - People Cards
description:
People Cards bring intelligent, Delve-like experiences to Office 365 apps (like Outlook on the Web, SharePoint Online document libraries and OneDrive for Business), right in the context of your work. When you hover over a person’s name or image, people cards expands to reveal contact information, organizational relationships and documents they have been working on.
  Now, People cards will appear on the SharePoint home page in Office 365 (you get there by clicking the "SharePoint" tile in the Office 365 app launcher). See a person’s name or photo, and simply hover over to learn more about them and the work they do. People cards are within reach where you are working and will help you prepare and stay informed throughout your day.

title: OneNote Ink Math Assistant now with graphing
description: OneNote can now graph handwritten equations and even let you manipulate variables to see the visual effect of changes. It can also teach you the steps to solve systems of equations. This expanded built-in intelligence within OneNote makes it an even more powerful math coach to help you learn in context.

title: Project Center Scale and Performance Improvements
description: We are making improvements to Project Center to decrease the load time and make it scale when you have access to more projects. For more details, please read the Office blog post.

title: Advanced Data Governance Events Based Retention
description: Allows customers to create events that will trigger the retention period of content in Office 365 Advanced Data Governance for records management purposes. For example, retention period of a contract will begin after the project completion date.

title: Microsoft Teams - External access - guest in a team
description: Ability to add a guest to a team from outside the organization

title: Microsoft Teams - WhoBot
description: Availability of a bot that uses natural language processing to help users discover experts and contacts in their organization

title: Usage reports update: General Availability of Microsoft Graph Reporting APIs and Office 365 adoption content pack APIs
description: The Office 365 usage reporting APIs and the adoption content pack APIs will enable customers to  programmatically access the data from the usage reports in the new admin center and integrate it into custom applications like a company reporting portal.

title: US Gov: Drive Shipping and Network Based Data Import for Office 365
description: The ability to import data into Office 365 in a quick and easy manner has been a known constraint of Office 365, and a solution for this issue has emerged as a key request from customers. We are working on a solution that will allow quicker imports of data into Exchange Online Archive Mailboxes. You will now be able to import Exchange Online data through PST files into the service without using third party tools. Drive Shipping and Network Based Ingestion options will use Azure-based services to import data. Over time we will be extending this to other data types across Office 365. Drive shipping is currently available to commercial tenants, and this roadmap item is specific to US Government (GCC). [Update 3/9: PST import is now available in GCC and GCC High. Support via ExpressRoute will be added in late Summer.]

title: Office 365 Groups: naming policy in Azure Active Directory
description: Administrators can configure a policy for appending text to the beginning or end of a group name and email address for groups no matter where a group is created (e.g. Outlook, Planner, Power BI, etc.). Administrators can also configure a list of specific blocked words that can’t be used in group names, and rely on the native list of thousands of blocked words to keep their directories clean.

title: Outlook for Windows: Improved calendar attendance tracking
description: Now you can see other people's responses to a meeting request, even if you aren't the organizer.

title: Outlook for Windows: A smarter To: line
description: When you click the To: line to address a message, we suggest recipients you're likely to choose. Plus, you can see their picture, so you know you’re sending to the right person.

title: "My Tasks" App in Microsoft Teams.
description: This Microsoft Teams app will allow Microsoft Planner users to view all of their assigned tasks across plans from Teams.

title: Yammer:  Messaging Enhancements
description: Yammer will improve the messaging experience through a number of initiatives. These will include GIF integrations, celebrating first posts and typing indicators that will enhance messaging for Yammer.

title: Seen counts
description: Yammer will show view counts of users who read your message.

title: Flow for approvals and feedback
description: This feature was blended into the request sign-off feature.

title: Yammer Web Part for SharePoint
description: Yammer will call Yammer's API and surface conversations directly on SharePoint.

title: StaffHub: Multi-User Task Assignment & Tracking
description: Team members can now use StaffHub to assign and track tasks for multiple users -  making it easy to monitor team progress against shared activities such a training and onboarding.

title: Usage reports update: new Office Extensibility Add-Ins report
description: New report in the Office 365 usage dashboard. We continue to update the usage reports to provide you with a complete picture of how your organization is using Office 365. We’re adding a new Office Extensibility Add-Ins report that will help you understand how your organization leverages Office Add-Ins.

title: OneDrive for Business multi-geo and service level encryption support (private preview only)
description: With O365 multigeo, organizations would be able to save their OneDrive and Sharepoint data in their respective regions in order to abide by their security and legal rules. With customer key, service level encryption will be made available by allowing customers to hold their own encryption key

title: Flow custom action for content approval and publish
description: Establish a custom action to be used in custom Flows to approve and publish documents and files

title: Outlook for Android: Improved account and folder navigation
description: We are simplifying the experience of moving between multiple accounts and different folders in Outlook.

title: Outlook for Android: Improved conversations
description: Outlook now shows more of your conversation at once and provides clearer separation between individual messages, making it simpler to catch up on your conversations.

title: Outlook for iOS: Time to leave notifications
description: For events in your calendar that have a location, Outlook will notify when it is time to leave in order to arrive on time.

title: Microsoft Teams in India Datacenter
description: Ability to have India data residency for core customer data at rest, plus failover and disaster recovery

title: eDiscovery Compliance Boundaries
description: Segment eDiscovery searches and results by users as defined by your organization to allow compliance boundaries between business units, geographic location, or other divisions. This also includes full support of Compliance Security Filters for OneDrive for Business.

title: Office 365 Germany: Information Rights Management and Message Encryption
description: Information Rights Management (IRM) helps protect data across different workloads such as SharePoint, Exchange, and Office documents by easily applying Information Rights Management capabilities such as Do Not Forward and Company Confidential, as well as Office 365 Message Encryption.

title: Customer Guided tour to onboard new users
description: The first time a new user accesses OneDrive , they will be greeted with a guided tour of OneDrive explaining them the different features and functionalities of the product.

title: IRM library sync support for Windows
description: OneDrive sync client (NGSC) for Windows will support syncing of IRM (Information Rights Management) protected libraries in SharePoint Online.

title: Outlook for Android: Set status for calendar events
description: Show events on your calendar as free, busy, tentative or out of office and define Private setting.

title: Outlook for iOS: new RSVP options
description: New RSVP options to match other Outlook endpoints! For each RSVP (accept, tentative, or decline), user can choose 'edit response before sending' or 'don't send response.' Today the behavior is to always send a blank response email.

title: Outlook for Android: new RSVP options
description: New RSVP options to match other Outlook endpoints! For each RSVP (accept, tentative, or decline), user can choose 'edit response before sending' or 'don't send response.' Today the response always sends a blank email.

title: Outlook for Android: search improvements
description: Personalized suggestions will make it easier and faster to search, with less typing. Search will also return both email and contact information, and will be a more prominent experience by moving to the app taskbar.

title: Office 365 Secure Score - Active Seat Average Score and Reporting Updates
description:
Secure Score will add the ability for you to see the average score of organizations that have a similar number of Office 365 active seats.  Secure Score will also consolidate the number of reporting actions due to changes in Azure.

At the same time there will be updates to the service to help you compare you score between two different dates and the ability to search the list of actions.

title: SharePoint hub sites
description: SharePoint sites are the building blocks of the mobile and intelligent intranet. SharePoint hub sites bring together related sites to roll up news and activity, and to create cohesion with shared navigation and look-and-feel. A hub site can have both team sites and communication sites associated under it.

title: SharePoint web part: Planner
description: Site members will now be able to bring their project tasks, managed in Planner, directly into a SharePoint page or news article. The author simply places the new Planner web part within the layout of the page/news, and then selects which plan they wish to showcase within the SharePoint user interface.

title: StaffHub: Coming to Office 365 App Launcher
description: Microsoft StaffHub is coming to the Office 365 app launcher. Making it easier to discover and access StaffHub from inside the Office 365 experience. This update corresponds with a refreshed web experience and additional value including the ability to assign and track tasks for multiple users, support customer-defined terms and conditions, and benefit from Intune and Mobile App Management.

title: StaffHub: Communicate across platforms with Teams Interop
description: Microsoft StaffHub will adopt the Microsoft Teams chat experience, allowing users to communicate across services.

title: StaffHub: Broadcast Open Shifts for Employees
description: Team members can now use StaffHub to broadcast open shifts -  making it easier for Firstline managers to fill schedules and for Firstline Workers to pick up an extra shift.

title: Outlook for Android:  Conversation count icon indicator
description: See how many unread email conversations you have with an indicator on the Outlook application icon found on the home screen of most Samsung and Sony devices.

title: Modern Web experience for Office files
description: We're introducing a faster, more collaborative Word experience for SharePoint and OneDrive documents on the web. You'll be able to get started right away on typing and collaborating now that documents open directly into an Edit mode.

title: New office desktop sharing experience (Windows)
description: OneDrive has a universal sharing UI both in web view and in File explorer / Mac finder so that users have a seamless experience. This sharing UI has now also been standardized across Office desktop clients of Word, PowerPoint and Excel.

title: Shared by me view (OneDrive web UI only)
description: OneDrive web users will use this new view to see the files in their OneDrive that are shared with others.

title: SharePoint web part: Twitter
description: Site members will now be able to showcase Twitter feeds and individual tweets right inside SharePoint pages and news. It simple to add the Twitter web part within the layout, and then plug in the desired Twitter feed, search criteria or individual tweets.

title: StaffHub: Yammer Integration
description: Team members can access important company news or announcements made in Yammer directly in StaffHub - allowing Firstline Workers to stay up to date and connected to the organization.

title: StaffHub: Distributed Content Based on Role and Shift
description: Organizations can now leverage StaffHub to distribute content to workers based on role, shift or need - making it easier for workers to access the right resources when and where they need it to do their best work.

title: Centralized Deployment of Outlook add-ins
description:
Following the launch of Centralized Deployment of Word Excel and PowerPoint add-ins in June we will now be rolling out support for Centralized deployment  for Outlook add-ins, initially in preview in the next few weeks .  Centralized Deployment will allow administrators to deploy add-ins to users  or groups through the 
Office admin center .  Add-ins could  be assigned to entire org, selected user-ids or to a distribution group ( DL), security group or an Office 365 group.

title: OneDrive for iOS - UI updates and universal link support
description: The UI of the OneDrive for iOS app is revamped with a new layout that uses your screen space more efficiently allowing you to find your files faster. Universal links are now supported so that links to OneDrive for Business and SharePoint files or folders will now open directly in the OneDrive app.

title: Files Restore
description: Enable self-service file recovery from disastrous events such as mass deletes, corruption, and other data loss scenarios.

title: File Hover Card
description: With the new OneDrive Web UI refresh, we have launched another feature called the File Hover card. As soon as you hover your mouse over a file you will be able to see file details like access stats - number of views, who viewed , who modified.

title: StaffHub: Simplifies workday management with “StaffHub Now”
description: Team members can now use StaffHub Now to see and access all the news for the day directly in the app and benefit from a refreshed mobile experience and feature set.

title: Office 365: Prevent events from hitting the 500 recipient limit
description: Office 365 allows up to 500 recipients on an email message or meeting invitation. However, if a meeting organizer sent an invitation to a distribution list (counted as only 1 recipient), attendees were added as individual recipients when they responded. So after more than 500 attendees responded, the meeting organizer could no longer update the meeting because there were now more than 500 recipients. We have made a first step in fixing this issue by no longer tracking individual responses (and therefore adding recipients) once there are 400 recipients. In a future update, we’ll track meeting responses in a separate property and use that when displaying attendee responses in Outlook.

title: StaffHub: IT Admin Portal Reporting and Capabilities
description: Tenant admins will now have access to usage data for all StaffHub teams in their organization. The report will include information about the size of the team, members and owners on the team, along with which devices and features each team is using. Additionally, we continue to simplify the management of Microsoft StaffHub with new PowerShell cmdlets for Microsoft StaffHub.

title: Polls on mobile - iOS
description: Users will now be able to conduct polls on Yammer through their mobile phones.

title: Microsoft Teams - Transfer to PSTN Call
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Ability to take a call and transfer it to a PSTN Number.

title: Word SharePoint Properties Pane
description:
View and edit document library metadata values directly inside Word 2016 (Windows) in a panel alongside the 
document.

title: Outlook for iOS and Android in GCC
description: Outlook for iOS and Android will meet all compliance commitments when used to access mailboxes in Exchange Online GCC. This update aligns with FedRAMP, CJIS, IRS 1075, continental US content storage, and US citizen operational personnel. (Outlook Mobile support with GCC High and DoD to follow.)

title: Outlook for Windows:  Read Aloud
description: Outlook can read your email aloud, highlighting text as it's read. Improves ease of access to email for everyone.

title: Praise on mobile - Android
description: Users will now have the ability to praise their coworkers on Yammer through their mobile phones.

title: Microsoft Teams - Give and Take control in sharing
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Support remote desktop control via meetings in Teams.

title: Microsoft Teams - Messaging Policies
description: This is one of the Office 365 IT Pro capabilities coming to Teams. Administrators will be able to set user level policies to control messaging experiences in Teams.

title: Microsoft Teams - Unified Presence
description: This is one of the SfB messaging capabilities coming to Teams that supports unified presence between Teams and Skype for Business.

title: Microsoft Teams - Share/Mute chat
description: This is one of the SfB messaging capabilities coming to Teams. This feature supports actions such as Share/ Mute chat.

title: Microsoft Teams - Anonymous Join
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. This policy controlled feature will enable anonymous users to join meetings. We also will support the lobby functionality.

title: Microsoft Teams - Contact Groups
description: This is one of the SfB messaging capabilities coming to Teams and provides support for Contact Groups originally created in Skype for Business.

title: SharePoint Admin Center
description: The new SharePoint Admin Center experience is rolling out to First Release customers beginning on January 22, 2018.

title: An improved add-in store experience inside Outlook
description:
Outlook add-ins enable you to access apps and services you most commonly use - whether that's customer relationship management software, a work management service or a translator tool, right in email, so you can accomplish more, faster.
 
We are now rolling out an improved add-in store experience within Outlook, with a redesigned layout, improved search experience and quick start guides, so you can find the right add-ins more quickly and easily.

title: Outlook for Mac:  Google Calendar and Contacts
description: Sync and view your Google account calendar and contact details in Outlook.

title: Office 365 Message Encryption: Encrypt Only
description: We recently released new Office 365 Message Encryption capabilities in September, which enables users to seamlessly share encrypted and rights protected messages with anyone. We are adding new value into Office 365 Message Encryption so users can now only encrypt their sensitive emails without applying additional message restrictions such as Do Not Forward.  The 'encrypt only' can be applied through either through the Outlook client or Admin portal.

title: Alt text on mobile - Android
description: Yammer will allow users to input alt text onto images they upload through their mobile phones in order to make generated content more accessible.

title: Alt text on mobile - iOS
description: Yammer will allow users to input alt text onto images they upload through their mobile phones in order to make generated content more accessible.

title: Related Groups on iOS
description: Related Groups is Phase 1 of bringing the right navigation resources inside groups onto the mobile app.

title: Microsoft Teams - Safe Transfer
description:
Safe Transfer means that once the transfer is initiated, the original call sticks around until the transfer is complete (i.e. called picked up by transfer-target or redirected to voicemail). If the transfer fails for any reason, the original call can be resumed. This allows the person initiating the transfer to make sure that the caller reaches the right destination, and provide the right messaging if that fails for some reason.
 E.g. If A calls B, and B transfers A to C. Then the call between A and B is put on hold while the transfer is happening. If the transfer to C fails, then B can resume the original call with A. The transfer to C is termed successful if C picks up, or if A reaches C's voicemail.

title: Microsoft Teams - Lobby Support
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. This feature supports delegate and lobby support for users.

title: Move conversations
description: Yammer will enable users to move threads from one group to another.

title: Microsoft Teams - Messaging Interop IT Policies
description: This is one of the Office 365 IT Pro messaging capabilities coming to Teams. Administrators will be able to set policies which govern messaging Inter/Op between Teams and Skype for Business.

title: Office 365 Admin Center for GCC High and DoD
description: The Office 365 Admin Center provides a simple, consolidate user interface for managing Office 365 subscriptions, provisioning user accounts, and configuring services. Role based access controls allow for management of various services without global admin control, and the Service Health Dashboard and Message Center allow admins to remain aware of incidents and changes. [Update: The Admin Center is available in GCC High as of late January and will be released in DoD pending review with DISA. Unique endpoint is portal.office365.us for GCC High.]

title: Azure Active Directory Government (compatible with Office 365 GCC High and DoD)
description: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) is a comprehensive identity and access management cloud solution that gives you a robust set of capabilities to manage users and groups. It helps secure access to on-premises and cloud applications, including Microsoft web services like Office 365, and many non-Microsoft software as a service (SaaS) applications.

title: Outlook Office Dictation
description: Use Office Dictation to dictate email messages in Outlook for Windows. Just click the Dictate button on the ribbon to start.

title: Typing indicators on mobile
description: Yammer will include typing indicators on our mobile apps. Typing indicators will show when someone is writing in your thread or post.

title: OneDrive for iOS - Drag and drop support
description: You can drag files from other apps, such as iMessage, into your OneDrive, drag files out of your OneDrive to other apps, and drag files in between folders in OneDrive.

title: OneDrive for iOS - Files app integration
description: OneDrive integration with the iOS Files app allows you to access, upload, edit, and save your content to OneDrive or SharePoint from apps that support File app integration. You can also tag and favorite your OneDrive and SharePoint files from within the Files app.

title: Office ATP Enhanced Reporting
description: Office 365 ATP will now enhance its reporting capabilities to offer near real-time reporting.  Additionally, new reporting capabilities will include: Malware Family Report Submissions Report Phish Report Malicious Content Report

title: Outlook for iOS: Favorite Folders, and Groups
description: Bringing Groups functionality into the Outlook for iOS. Users will be able to add groups and folders as favorites and have easy access to these favorites in the sidebar. All favorites will sync across devices.

title: Outlook for Android: Favorite Folders and Groups
description: Bringing Groups functionality into the Outlook for Android. Users will be able to add groups and folders as favorites and have easy access to these favorites in the sidebar. All favorites will sync across devices.

title: eDiscovery - Export all content to archive (zip)
description: This update to Office 365 eDiscovery capabilities provides an alternate eDiscovery export format that reduces the necessity of truncating file paths when the file paths would exceed 260 characters.

title: Microsoft Bookings - Multi-day and all-day bookings
description: Bookings now offers support for multi-day and all-day service appointments.

title: Microsoft Bookings - Customizable time increments
description: Bookings will now offer full control over exactly when your appointments are available.

title: Bulk metadata editing
description: This feature allows you to edit the metadata of several items at once by selecting those items in the modern list view, and using the details pane to edit their metadata.

title: Security & Compliance Center Message Trace
description: This is a new message trace interface appearing in the Security and Compliance center, in addition to the message trace capability currently available in the Exchange Admin Center. This new interface provides a tool for admins to troubleshoot and track the health of their organization's mail flow.

title: GCC High SKU Name
description: When Microsoft launched Office 365 GCC High and services delivered from this environment, the SKUs in commerce systems was titled "DODCON" and is now being updated to align more closely with the environment naming. In early 2018, DODCON SKUs will update to GCC High. This update has no impact on the products or users and is just to simplify the licensing and contracting experience.

title: Compliance Manager GA
description: Compliance Manager GA will provide Compliance Scores reflecting your compliance and data protection stature. It also supports more Microsoft cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure.

title: Assignments on mobile and tablet
description: Assignments on iOS and Android for Teams in Office 365 Education available.

title: Dictation in Word
description: This simple yet transformational tool will help students of all abilities to write freely by using only their voice. Starting in February, Dictation will be available in Word, Word Online, PowerPoint, Outlook Desktop, OneNote Windows 10, and OneNote Online—and in more than nine languages.

title: Azure Advanced Threat Protection (ATP) General Availability
description: Azure Advanced Threat Protection (ATP) for Users, is a new cloud service which empowers your Security Operations team to detect and investigate advanced attacks and insider threats across the entire scope of users and entities in your network. Leveraging cloud infrastructure and Azure scale, Azure ATP is built to support the most demanding workloads of security analytics for the modern enterprise.

title: Microsoft Stream: Tier C Status in Office Trust Framework
description: Inclusion of Microsoft Stream in the Office Trust Framework with Tier C status. For more info: http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=615657

title: File Move in SharePoint and OneDrive
description: From the SharePoint and OneDrive modern library experience, support full fidelity move for files and content including versions and metadata among all OneDrive and SharePoint locations.

title: Improved search experience in SharePoint
description: Rich previews of over 270+ different, people matches and personalized ranking of results to help you find what you are looking for faster, highlight the new experience for search in SharePoint. Builds on earlier personalization of SP Home, and as announced at Ignite.

title: Microsoft Stream: Group spotlight videos
description: Ability for group owners to feature or spotlight videos on a group's Stream page that they want users visiting the group to see. Spotlight videos are pinned into the video carousel at the top of the group homepage.

title: New Sharing Experience for Message Center
description: After receiving customer feedback on the existing experience, we're releasing an improved sharing experience for Message Center posts. In-product, customers will now be able to seamlessly share individual Message Center posts via email, add a personalized message, and receive a copy of the email. This feature will be available in targeted release for 30 days before general availability.

title: OneNote Class Notebook Features
description: Updates to Class Notebook include assignment and grade integration with more than 35 of the most widely used LMS and SIS, including Capita SIMS in the U.K. To further simplify classroom workflows, we are delivering on the number one request from teachers for Class Notebooks, enabling lock pages. Teachers can now lock pages as read only after giving feedback to the student. We are also enabling Demos interactive math calculators, a set of popular applications for STEM teachers. Plus we’ve added four new sticker packs. The new packs include Feathered Friends, Science, Circus Animals and Arrows.

title: Immersive Reader Updates
description: Immersive Reader is coming to even more platforms in 2018. Soon Immersive Reader will also be available on Word for Mac, iPhone and Android as well as Outlook Desktop, and OneNote for iPhone, iPad, and Mac. To further support students of different backgrounds Immersive Reader will also support an additional 10 new languages.

title: New start experience for Office 365 web applications
description: We're updating the start experience for the Office 365 web applications to improve discoverability of existing documents and make it easier to collaborate with others in the cloud.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Blind copy warning
description: Be warned before accidentally responding to an email when you are blind copied.

title: Outlook Calendar sync with Microsoft Planner
description: Make better scheduling and time-management decisions by publishing tasks to your calendar.  By adding your tasks to your Outlook calendar, you’ll never lose track of current and upcoming tasks—helping you meet your deliverables.

title: Planner: Due Date Notifications
description: Receive an email notification summarizing tasks due in the coming week—and stay on top of your approaching deliverables.

title: Microsoft Stream: Homepage spotlight videos
description: Ability for Stream admins to feature or spotlight videos on the Stream video portal homepage for all users in their organization to see. Spotlight videos are pinned into the video carousel at the top of the Microsoft Stream homepage.

title: Changes to the Following feed in Yammer
description: Yammer will allow users to now see people, topics, and files that you follow in the “Following” home feed.

title: Planner: Schedule view
description: Meet deadlines, plan ahead, and understand project status with the ability to view your task schedule. In addition, weekly and monthly task views allow drag-and-drop scheduling.

title: Planner Filtering and new Group By options
description: The Group and Filter options in Planner give you deeper insights into your tasks to help you meet key deadlines. For example, filter your tasks by due date to better understand approaching deadlines. Or use the Group feature to view tasks that have not been started, so you can prioritize your work.

title: Redesigned 'Me Control'
description: We're making some changes to the Office 365 ‘Me Control’. This is the set of profile controls accessible via the user’s name and profile picture in the upper right corner of Office.com. This update simplifies the design of the control and makes changing your profile picture easier.

title: Enhanced Remediation with Office 365 Threat Intelligence
description: Recent updates to Office 365 Threat Intelligence allow Security Admins and Analysts to soft delete or hard delete malicious mails discovered in their Office 365 environment.

title: Microsoft Project:  Set percent complete from a task board
