description: Set % Complete field in Task Board, Sprint, and Kanban views allows you to update percent complete for tasks when you move them from column to column. This percent complete will persist in your Gantt Chart view as well.

title: Enhanced Email Anti-impersonation Capabilities in Office 365
description: New email anti-impersonation capabilities are now available for all office ATP/E5 customers.  These new capabilities will help protect end users from domain, user, and first contact impersonation.  These features are live now.  Enhanced brand impersonation will roll out in the coming weeks.

title: SharePoint web part: Kindle Instant Preview
description: Site members will now be able to showcase embedded Kindle books directly on a SharePoint page or news article. Once you have the embed code from Amazon.com, you add the Kindle web part, paste in the embed code and the interactive book advertisement appears.

title: SharePoint web part: Office 365 Connectors
description: Bring external feeds of information via Office 365 Connectors directly into a SharePoint page or news article. You can bring in feeds from third party services like JIRA, Asana, Facebook, Bing News, GitHub and more. Once you establish and authenticate the connection, the feed of information will show up inline on the page.

title: New ways how to interact with
description:
New features in Microsoft Teams makes it an even more powerful hub for teamwork by enabling you to use apps in new ways—including the ability to take quick actions from the command box and to add apps to your new personal space.
Find and use apps in new ways – Now, you can include interactive cards from apps in conversations the same way you would add an emoji or GIF. With one click, you can bring important information like a task from Trello into a channel conversation or chat. Finding new apps and services in Teams is also easier with the new Store where you can search for apps by name or category, such as Project Management or Analytics.

Command apps and take quick actions across Teams – Yesterday, we introduced the new command box in Microsoft Teams, a single point of entry that integrates your search and command experiences. Now, you can quickly interact with apps, perform tasks and navigate throughout Teams directly from the command box, in addition to searching across people, messages, files, and apps.

title: Microsoft Project Task Boards: Board filtering
description: Filter your Task Board view to see tasks related to either a specific resource or summary task. You can also use these filters when viewing Sprint or Kanban boards.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Options for calendar reminders
description: Set reminders to pop up over windows you're working in. Otherwise, Outlook will blink in the taskbar to get your attention.

title: Microsoft Project:  Sprint Navigation
description: Quickly switch sprint views and move tasks forward. Easily switch between sprints, identify your current sprint, and move tasks forward to the next sprint.

title: Planner: Access Microsoft Teams plans in Planner Hub
description: Access plans you create in Microsoft Teams in the Planner web app.  Favorite a plan or view the team and channels associated with it.  You can also open the plan in Teams or keep working in Planner.  This feature is coming to the Planner mobile app soon as well.

title: Outlook for iOS:  Organization charts
description: Know who's who within your company with quick access to the organization structure, including the manager, direct reports and other colleagues.

title: Outlook for Mac:  Start/End calendar events across time zones
description: Schedule and view calendar events that start and end in different time zones.

title: Outlook for Mac: View event details at a glance
description: View important event card details at a glance. Check out who was invited, edit your response, or join the meeting with just one click.

title: Outlook for Mac:  View two time zones
description: Add a second time zone to your Outlook calendar. Now you'll always know what time it is in another part of the world with a side-by-side view.

title: Office 365 Cloud App Security  - General Anomaly Detection Policy Update
description: New default policies will be created based on the use cases that the current general anomaly detection policy covers.  The existing general anomaly detection policy will be disabled.

title: Calendar - Improvements to the MailboxFolderPermission cmdlet
description: We are rolling out an update so that you can now manage calendar delegate permissions from the *-MailboxFolderPermission cmdlet.

title: Microsoft Teams - Hide/Share/Mute chat
description: This is one of the SfB messaging capabilities coming to Teams. This feature supports actions such as Hide chat.

title: Office 365 Cloud App Security - Productivity App Discovery enhancements
description: The Productivity App Discovery feature will be expanded to include additional details like top ip address and user details.

title: Single Sign-On for iOS
description: Yammer will enable single sign-on for iOS apps.

title: Enhanced Anti-Spoof Capabilities for Office ATP
description: 1.	New advanced learning and intelligence will be applied on top of standard email authentication standards (SPF, DMARC, DKIM) validation to infer authentication status for domains based on their sending infrastructure properties. and reject If a message fails our implicit authentication, it is marked as junk.   2.	Admins can use policies to customize the actions and additionally block or allow specific senders based on their authentication status.

title: Trainer Preview
description: The Microsoft 365 security and compliance center enables data administrators, compliance officers, security administrators, and security operations to discover security and compliance controls across Office 365, Enterprise Mobility + Security, and Windows in a single place.    Note that you must have purchased Microsoft 365 via the CSP program to get the Microsoft 365 security and compliance center.

title: Update to Office 365 groups hover card in SharePoint
description: We’re improving the way SharePoint users interact with Office 365 Groups by adding new features to the groups hover card. The improved groups card appears when you hover over a group name in SharePoint and gives users easy access to all the components of a group, including conversations, calendar, files, planner and more. If group permissions allow it, users will be able to join, leave, follow and un-follow groups, right from the groups hover card.

title: Introducing new Office Start Pages
description: Newly redesigned Office Start Pages for Word, PowerPoint and Excel will help you get started more easily with new documents, pick up where you left off with recently used documents and find shared documents to work together with others.

title: Microsoft Teams & Skype for Business Admin Center
description: The new Microsoft Teams & Skype for Business Admin Center will provide you a unified experience to manage Microsoft Teams and Skype for Business. We’re delivering additional functionality, end-to-end insights, and the ability to manage Teams settings on a user level.

title: Office 365 Groups created from Microsoft Teams will be hidden from Outlook by default
description: Based on customer feedback, new Office 365 Groups generated as a result of creating a team in Microsoft Teams will no longer show in Outlook by default. For customers that want to continue with the existing behavior of showing these groups in Outlook, an Exchange Online PowerShell cmdlet will be provided which can enable the group for the Outlook experience. Groups created through Outlook and then later enabled for Teams will continue to show in both Outlook and Teams. This update will gradually roll out across Outlook and Teams in the coming months.

title: Update: Message Center automatic language translations
description: In December, we rolled out automatic translations in Message Center. We've heard your feedback and updated the machine learning translation experience. If your admin center settings are set to a non-English language, you will see an option within message center to opt into auto-translate all message center posts to the admin language. In addition, you can manually choose to translate message center posts to any other language provided. You can view the original post in English by opting out of auto-translate or manually selecting English in the list of translatable languages.

title: Groups in Outlook: New create option to let people outside the org email a group for Outlook
description: Now when you create a group from the Exchange Admin center you can select to allow external users to email that group directly.

title: SharePoint mobile: direct document library access
description: As you tap into a SharePoint document library, you will stay within the SharePoint mobile app experience (for viewing and navigating) more before taken through the integrated connection to the OneDrive app - where you can perform richer actions on files and folders.

title: Microsoft Stream: Deployed to Government Community Cloud
description: Microsoft Stream will be enabled and deployed to the Government Community Cloud instances of O365.

title: Group resources on mobile
description: Yammer will bring the right navigation resources inside groups onto the mobile app. This will include the 'Group Actions', 'Office 365 Resources, and 'Pinned' tabs.

title: Microsoft Teams - Group Call Pickup
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. The feature allows support for Group Call Pickup.

title: Polls on mobile - Android
description: Users will now have the ability to create polls on Yammer through their mobile phones.

title: Microsoft Teams - Location Based Routing
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Ability to take a call and transfer it to a PSTN Number.

title: Microsoft Teams - Shared Line Appearance
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for Shared Line Appearance.

title: Timeline view in Microsoft Planner
description: Display and share views of Planner tasks on a timeline

title: Intelligent Discovery for iOS
description: From the OneDrive app, Discover view uses the Office Graph to suggest relevant and trending files from Office 365. The Discover view suggests content that is most relevant for each person based on the work they are doing and the people with whom they engage.

title: Sway Admin: Sway in the Office 365 Auditing and Protection Center
description: Office 365 admins will be able to audit how Sway is used in their organizations. They will have visibility into who has created/edited Sways, changed sharing options for Sways, and other user actions.

title: Outlook for Windows: Improvements to OneDrive attachment handling
description: When you save or drag and drop OneDrive attachments to your computer, we download the file for you.

title: Basic Co-authoring on Excel Desktop
description: Excel on Windows PCs: (1) co-authoring in spreadsheets (currently available for Office Insiders Fast).  This Feature ID replaces 14958 which was a duplicate.

title: Skype for Business Regionally Hosted Meetings
description: Support for a Multi National Corporation tenant to have users be distributed across multiple Data centers for Skype for Business Online in the Multi-Tenant environment to provide better media quality by reduced latency.

title: Office 365 Groups: expiring groups
description: To support administrators’ desire to keep their directories clear of stale or inactive content, we’re working on a policy that would expire inactive Office 365 Groups over a definable period of time.

title: Outlook for Mac: Delay Send
description: Delay the delivery of a message or choose when it will be sent. (Office 365 work or school account required).

title: OneDrive for Business filename support improvements
description: We’re adding support for file names that contain ‘%’ or ‘#’ characters.

title: MyAnalytics: Share
description: The MyAnalytics dashboard will the add the ability to share a summary, specific module or portion of your MyAnalytics dashboard with others via email. This will enable the ability to create better work habits in partnership with others in your organization.

title: Maps in Excel (iOS)
description: Powered by Bing Maps, Maps in Excel enable users to create professional visualizations in just a few steps for work, home and school.

title: Word on Windows PCs and Macs
description: Word on Macs: (a) New Editor pane provides additional information and context (currently available for Office Insiders Fast)

title: PowerPoint on Windows PCs and Macs
description: PowerPoint on Windows PCs: (a) Quickstarter; (b) Automatic alternative text descriptions (alt-text) for images

title: MyAnalytics Outlook add-in update – insights feed
description: The MyAnalytics Outlook add-in will be updated to provide more in the work flow assistance with a feed of productivity insights. For example, the add-in will provide you a weekly forecast, help you proactively schedule focus time for your big rocks, summarize unread email from Important people you’ve pinned, and provide new dwell time insights around quality of email engagement.

title: Office 365 Advanced eDiscovery Optical Character Recognition (OCR)
description: Office 365 Advanced eDiscovery Optical Character Recognition (OCR), enables the extraction of text from images. OCR is supported for loose files, email attachments and embedded images. This feature allows the powerful text analytic capabilities of Advanced eDiscovery, including near-duplicates, email threading, themes and predictive coding, to be applied to image files.

title: Office 365 Secure Score - Ability to ignore a control
description: Office 365 Secure Score will support the option to allow a customer to ignore a control and have it not count towards the denominator of their score.

title: SharePoint Online - personalized search from SharePoint home in Office 365
description: Search results are trimmed using the Microsoft Graph, enabling a more relevant, intuitive, personalized experience when searching for content and people from the SharePoint home search boxes. As you click into the search box, you're presented with recent items you've been working on. And as you type, you'll see this list of recent items refine to the keyword(s) you type. And then on the results page, you'll see relevant sites, files and people all based on who you work with and what you and they work on.

title: Modern library field view customization
description: Support field level formatting and scripting for modern list and library pages.

title: SharePoint Online communication sites
description: To help keep everyone informed and engaged, we are introducing beautiful, dynamic, mobile-ready communication sites for Office 365 customers. Communication sites are created in seconds by clicking 'Create site' on SharePoint home in Office 365.  Then, it's easy to adjust page layouts and add web parts and to pull in valuable data and content from other services, like conversations from Yammer and videos from Microsoft Stream. The result is a vibrant, interactive, dynamic experiences for your site visitors.

title: Microsoft Teams - T-Bot user guidance
description: Availability of additional messages from T-Bot to guide user engagement...

title: Microsoft Teams - Sharing chat history
description: Ability to share history of a chat with more than the original participants

title: Microsoft Teams - Outlook scheduling add-in
description: Ability to add a Microsoft Teams meeting add in to Outlook so that users can schedule Microsoft Teams meetings from within Outlook

title: Outlook Customer Manager
description: Outlook Customer Manager helps small businesses track and grow relationships with customers right within Outlook. It gives you a complete view of your interactions with each customer, helps you track tasks and deals in progress, and surfaces timely reminders – all next to your inbox where you need these.  Now stay on top of your customer relationships, without any need to install or learn separate tools. Included at no extra cost to Office 365 Business Premium subscribers, Outlook Customer Manager is a cloud-powered solution designed especially for the needs of small businesses. It is available in 39 languages in Outlook for Windows, iOS, and on the web. A mobile app for iOS is coming soon.  Outlook Customer Manager is now rolling out to all Office 365 Business Premium customers worldwide. Once it has rolled out to your Office 365 account, you will see an icon for it in the home tab in Outlook 2016 for Windows. Just click the icon to get started.  Learn more at msft.social/zLJpVn

title: Parent and Guardian links, Permissions in the Collaboration Space in OneNote Class Notebook
description: These capabilities include the ability for teachers to create read-only Parent and Guardian links, Permissions in the Collaboration Space to allow project based learning, and the ability to remove student content when removing student permissions in a Class Notebook.

title: Increasing Project Online Site Limits to 30,001
description:
We are increasing the number of supported projects sites in Project Online to 30,000. 
For more details, please read the Office blog post.

title: Introducing the new Office 365 Group Card
description: We’re improving the way Outlook on the web users interact with Office 365 Groups with a newly refreshed group card that gives you easy access to all the components of a group, such as conversations, calendar, notebook, files, planner, and so on. You'll be able to easily join, leave, follow and un-follow groups at your convenience. Look for more components and features in the future with our new, refreshed look! It will start gradually rolling out to customers in First Release, and we will monitor usage and feedback as we continue to increase the usage base that sees the new design.

title: Safe Links in Office 365 ProPlus
description: Safe Links in Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection now extends protection to Office 365 ProPlus desktop clients. When a user clicks a link in Office 365 client applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, Advanced Threat Protection will inspect the link to see if it is malicious. If the link is malicious, the user will be redirected to a warning page instead of the original target URL. This new capability further integrates and expands security across Office 365.

title: Office 365 Groups: classification is available when creating or modifying a group across apps
description: Selecting a Group classification is now available when creating or editing a group across the following Office 365 applications: Outlook, SharePoint, Planner, Teams, Yammer and StaffHub.

title: Outlook for Mac: Favorite Folders
description: Outlook will now support making folders as Favorites. These folders will then show up under Favorites at the top of the Sidebar.

title: SharePoint - Library viewer web part
description: Deploy filterable, reusable web part that allows an embeddable, read-only view against library contents (files are still editable with correct permissions.)

title: SharePoint - List view web part
description: Deploy filterable, reusable web part that allows an embeddable, read-only list view (items are still editable with correct permissions.)

title: SharePoint - Metadata library navigation support
description: Develop an in-context hierarchical drill through view filter capability based on metadata for libraries and lists in the filters pane.

title: SharePoint - Simple site navigation edit
description: You can quickly add and arrange links to your important pages at the top portion of a communication site. And for team sites, you can adjust the left-hand navigation by linking to pages, lists, and now you can quickly add links to other associated Office 365 Group elements, like your groups conversation, calendar and planner ... all to make it easier to add the links and manage how they appear on your site.

title: SharePoint - Site usage page
description: Site owners can easily see what's going on within their site, to see what content is doing well, and how people are engaging with their site information.

title: SharePoint - Web part: Events
description: If you have important events you want to highlight on your home page in a team site or communication, or on a sub page or news article, you can now add events to the associated events list and have them appear for your viewers both visually and they can click "Add to calendar" if they want to track your event item(s) from within their Outlook experience.

title: SharePoint - Web part: Hero
description: The hero web part is commonly used at the top of a home page, a sub page, or a news article to visually highlight and link off to the most important content. You simply upload an image, associated a link and header text, and publish. You can also adjust the layout of the hero web part to fit your needs.

title: SharePoint - Web part: People
description: Highlight important people by leveraging the People web part. Add it to your team sites or communication site page, or within a news article, and then do quick adds of numerous people via a Azure Active Directory (AAD) lookup. Once published, not only can viewers see the people you list, they can also hover over their names to see their people cards with contact and Microsoft Graph information and documents associated to them.

title: Microsoft Forms Preview for Office 365 Commercial Users
description: Microsoft Forms is a simple, lightweight app that lets you easily gather customer feedback, measure and improve business performance, learn what employees think, and plan and organize company events. It is coming to Preview to Office 365 Commercial users.

title: Increasing File Path Limit
description:
This update for SharePoint Online and OneDrive
 will increase the file path limit( server relative path) from 260- 400

title: SharePoint - News and pages: banner images
description: You can now add a hero image in the top banner section of your news articles and pages in SharePoint Online. You simply upload your image, choose the right focal point (which makes it look as intended for both web and mobile) and click publish. The service ensures the image scales properly and looks great to help people find and engage on your news and pages.

title: SharePoint - News and pages: comment on news articles
description: Once your news article has been published, it's important to engage with your audience and allow them to provide comments, feedback and to ask questions. Now, at the bottom of all new news and page article, viewers will have a chance to post comments and connect with authors keeping everyone informed and engaged.

title: People cards on SharePoint home in Office 365
description: Now, when you see a person name or face, you can hover over it and reveal their people card. You can then see their contact information and their relevant content that you have permissions to see - right in context without leaving the SharePoint home experience.

title: SharePoint app for Windows 10 Mobile: view news
description: If you use the SharePoint app for Windows 10 Mobile, you will now have the mobile experience of team news. When you tap the News tab, you will see a list of news tailored to you using the intelligence of Microsoft Graph. Now, SharePoint app for Windows 10 Mobile will give you one place to catch up on the news from across your intranet. That’s your news in your pocket!

title: SharePoint: connect an existing site to a new Office 365 group
description: Giving the ability to take an existing SharePoint Online team site and connect it to an Office 365 Group. The group provides membership management and other services like shared calendar, Planner, etc. will then provision.

title: Outlook for Windows: Changes to recurring meetings
description: The default end date is changing from "No end date" to prompting people to choose an end date.  No end date will still be an option.

title: Password protected links (consumer)
description: End users will be able to  implement passwords to protect the  links shared. Receivers with the password will be allowed to access the file only.

title: Multi-Geo Capabilities in Office 365
description: Multi-Geo enables a single Office 365 tenant to span across multiple Office 365 datacenter geographies (geos), and store data at-rest on a per-user basis in customer chosen geos. This helps customers to address their corporate, regional or local data residency requirements in Office 365. Multi-Geo is available for Exchange Online and OneDrive.

title: Office 365 Secure Score - Industry Average Score
description: Secure Score will display industry average scores that you can use to compare you score.

title: Transfer ownership for deleted users
description: Currently when a user leaves the ownership of their OneDrive rolls up to the manager. With this roll out, the admin will have the rights to transfer the ownership to the individual seen fit by the manager

title: Sway analytics
description: Office 365 users can now see how many people have viewed their Sways as well as the time spent and average completion ratios for their Sways.

title: New sign in experience for commercial customers
description: We're redesigning the sign-in UI for Microsoft services for greater consistency across consumer and commercial accounts. The new design prompts you to enter your username on the first screen followed by a credential (typically a password) on a second screen.  You will continue to see new features roll out to this preview experience in the coming months.

title: Bitcoin Currency Format Support for Excel Online
description: Now use Excel to track, calculate and analyze Bitcoin data using native Bitcoin number formatting options. Feature is first being rolled out to Excel 2016 for Windows, Excel Online, Excel Mobile for Windows and Excel Mobile for Android.

title: Resume Assistant, Powered by LinkedIn for Mac
description: Craft your best resume to land your dream job, using the power of LinkedIn right inside of Word

title: Microsoft Planner:  Guest User Access
description: Microsoft Planner now supports guest access. You can assign tasks and collaborate with team members who are not a part of the tenant. This helps teams collaborate with their customers, vendors, and partners more effectively.

title: Integration of Sync client into Mac Office
description: The OneDrive client will now be installed as part of the Office for Mac install process.

title: Attack Simulator for O365 Threat Intelligence
description: The public preview of Attack Simulator begins in January.  It is a new feature for Office 365 Threat Intelligence that enables admins to send simulated attacks (10-15 different attack categories including phish, brute force password cracking, etc.) to their end users to determine how they respond to attacks and determine if the right policies are in place to help mitigate real attacks.  This is a powerful service that enables proactive defense for organizations against the evolving threat landscape.

title: Microsoft Teams - Federated Chat between Teams and Skype for Business
description: This is one of the SfB messaging capabilities coming to Teams that enables a Teams user to chat with users in other organizations using Teams.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Simplified Office 365 and Outlook.com Shared and Delegate Calendar options
description: We've simplified the process for accepting invitations and assigning delegates for shared calendars from Outlook for Windows.  Now, calendars shared from Outlook for Windows will also be available on Outlook for iOS and Android.

title: Microsoft Forms rolling out to General Availability for Office 365 commercial subscribers
description:
Microsoft Forms will go out of Preview and into GA for Office 365 commercial subscribers in April 2018. 

At that time, we will introduce new settings for IT administrators to control users' sharing capabilities, bring in improvements to the portal page for group-owned forms, and continue enhancing service reliability.

title: ODB Multi-Geo Support on Mobile
description: Error Handling and sharing links

title: Mail Flow Insights in Security & Compliance Center
description: With this update admins can use the new mail flow dashboard in the Office 365 Security & Compliance Center to discover trends, insights and take actions to fix issues related to mail flow in Office 365.

title: Access: New charts for modern data visualization
description:
Introducing new charts to help you visualize data managed in Access in an appealing and modern way.
Add any of the eleven new chart types, including a combo chart, to a form/report to visualize your data and make informed decisions.

title: Office 365 Pro Plus for GCC High and DoD
description: Office 365 ProPlus delivers cloud-connected and always up-to-date versions of our most valuable enterprise apps (including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, OneNote, Publisher, Access, Skype for Business). With ProPlus, users can enjoy a fully installed Office experience across PCs, Macs, Windows tablets, iPad® and Android™ tablets, and most mobile devices. Each user can install Office on 5 PCs or Macs, 5 tablets (Windows, iPad, and Android), and 5 phones. For IT, ProPlus is the most secure way to experience Office 365. Plus being cloud connected and up to date— it’s always getting better with new security features, new telemetry and new management capabilities.

title: Microsoft Stream: Admin setting determine who can upload and who can create channels
description: Currently we have a single admin setting in Microsoft Stream that covers both who can upload and who can create companywide channels. With this change we'll split this single setting into two separate settings so you can manage the list of users allowed for each independently.

title: Microsoft Stream: Office 365 Video migration - admin opt-in phase
description: Office 365 Video will be transitioning to the new enterprise video service,  Microsoft Stream. Microsoft will aide in the migration of content from Office 365 Video to Microsoft Stream. The first phase will be an "opt-in" phase, where the O365 Video portal admin will have the option to click a button and walk through a migration wizard. The admin will be able to assess their use of O365 Video features compared to available features in Stream, move all O365 Video content to Stream, evaluate and verify the moved content, and finally make the migrated data final in Stream. After the transition is complete, all existing O365 Video player page and embed code URLs will be preserved and redirect to Stream.

title: Microsoft Stream: Transcript editor
description: Video owners can edit and make corrections to the transcript / closed captions automatically generated for a video.

title: Outlook for iOS: Proxy support
description: Support for commercial customers with SOCKS proxy.

title: Outlook for Android:  Proxy support
description: Support for commercial customers with SOCKS proxy.

title: Microsoft Stream: Organization branding via O365 top navigation bar
description: Incorporating the O365 suite shell top navigation bar into Microsoft Stream will allow the existing O365 organization branding (logo, colors, URL) that can be configured by admins to show up in Stream like it does for many other O365 Apps. This will also unify the app launching experience by using the same app launcher used by other O365 services.

title: Outlook for Mac: Create an Office 365 Group in Outlook
description: Create an Office 365 Group in Outlook for Mac.

title: Microsoft Project:  Easily manage sprints
description: We'll be making it easier for you to manage sprints

title: New support experience for Premier customers
description: We’re excited to announce that the new support experience will be available for all Premier customers. This experience includes an in-product flyout that connects customers quickly and effectively to the support they need. With positive feedback from other customer channels, we've added additional capabilities for more flexibility and efficiency, such as support via email, comprehensive view of ticket status and history, and CritSit designation on premier customer tickets for this rollout.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Forwarding Meeting Invites
description: Meeting organizers have an option to allow if their meetings can be forwarded to others.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Provide an option to show up to 3 time zones
description: Add a second and third time zone to your Calendar to show up to 3 time zones at once

title: Outlook for Android:  New homescreen widget
description: Get more details at a glance with an improved Widget.

title: Planner: SharePoint team site integration updates
description: Planner can now be added to any group connected team site, right from the homepage of a site.  This update include an integrated full page Planner experience, including boards and charts, and options to add Planner to site navigation.

title: Customized Sharing Defaults per SharePoint Site Collection
description: In SharePoint Online, Default sharing link types and Default sharing link permissions are now available to be customized per site collection.  In SharePoint Online, Default sharing link types and Default sharing link permissions are now available to be customized per site collection.  You can now configure the default link type and default link permission for your users in SharePoint Online and OneDrive for Business. With this change, you may now further customize the default sharing settings on a per site collection basis.

title: Office 365 security and compliance center available in DoD cloud
description: The Office 365 Security and Compliance Center is going to be available for the Office 365 DoD environment. The Office 365 Security & Compliance Center is your one-stop portal for helping you to protect and manage compliance for your data in Office 365. Use the Office 365 Security & Compliance Center to manage compliance for all your organization’s data across Office 365. The following experiences will be available: • Unified Data Loss Prevention • Reporting • Data Governance (Excluding Supervision) • Threat Intelligence • Threat Management (including ATP) • Permissions.

title: Flow trigger for item deletion
description: Build a custom process anytime an item or document is deleted

title: Outlook calendar - automatic processing of small changes in meeting details
description: When a meeting organizer updates a meeting details that do not affect the date/time/recurrence pattern (I.e. add Skype for Business meeting link), Office 365 will automatically process and add the changes to the invitees’ calendars without requiring the invitees receiving a meeting update in their inbox and having to respond again to the meeting invite. You will be able to customize the logic for what details should be auto-processed for your organization, and which ones should continue to be shown as a meeting update in the invitees’ inboxes. At this time, we are not going to provide an option in Outlook for the organizer to choose how updates go out.

title: Groups in Outlook and group-connected team sites in Office 365: Private by default
description: Based on customer's feedback we are updating the default privacy setting for groups created across all Outlook apps, and the associated group-connected team sites, to be private by default so only approved members can see what's inside the group and team site. For customers that want to continue with the existing behavior of public by default for all Outlook apps we will provide an Exchange Online PowerShell cmdlet to define the default value, or a simple update in the team site ‘Site information’ pane. This update will gradually rollout across Outlook and SharePoint in the coming months starting with Outlook on the web and SharePoint in Office 365.

title: Microsoft 365 Admin Center
description: The new Microsoft 365 Admin Center is a single place for admins to get started with Microsoft 365. Using the familiar UI of the Office 365 Admin Center, Microsoft 365 admins can use this space to manage their tenant and access the depth admin experiences necessary for their job. A new Microsoft 365 Security & Compliance Center, as well as Microsoft 365 Device Management can easily be accessed from the main admin center. The Security and Compliance Center will be available shortly, with Device Management to follow afterwards.

title: Outlook for Android: Block links to external images
description: Set up your account to block links in emails to external images.

title: New Sharing UX(ODB- Mobile)
description: We will deliver a similar sharing experience to what we have on the web and other endpoints which supports all link types supported within an organization.

title: Malware Detect
description: The sync client helps to keep your data safe by taking signals from the service and from Windows Defender and pausing sync automatically to stop the damage and then help with the recovery once it is safe to sync.

title: Full Microsoft AutoPilot/Intune support
description: Deploy and manage OneDrive sync using the Modern Deployment technologies from Microsoft

title: Files On-Demand for SharePoint Server 2019
description: Modern sync with SharePoint Server 2019. For users that have already migrated to the Windows 10 Fall Creators update or newer, they will be able to leverage Files On-Demand functionality on their Windows devices

title: Updates to organizational branding for Office 365
description: Custom organization logos will soon move from the center of the Office 365 navigation bar, and replace the Office 365 logo on the left side. By default, the color of the navigation bar will vary by application. If organizations wish to ensure that their custom logo shows up on the same navigation bar color across applications, they can set a custom navigation bar background color in the Organization profile section of the Admin Center.

title: Microsoft To-Do steps
description: Steps enable users to easily break down tasks into subtasks

title: Export user data
description: Yammer will give admins the option to export an individual's user data from the admin panel.

title: Erase user in Yammer
description: Yammer will give admins the ability to erase a users' name and personal information in Yammer, as well as their user usage data.

title: ATP SIEM Integration
description: ATP threat feeds can be integrated to most of the commonly used SIEM solutions via the Office 365 management activity API.

title: Enhanced EOP/ATP Email Quarantine Capabilities
description:
1.  New UI enabling quick search for emails by sender/recipient/network message id, etc.
2.  Email in Quarantine -- ability for admin to download the email and/or release the email to other recipients (e.g. admin release). These are available via Powershell today and we will expose these in the UX

title: Groups in Outlook - Members of newly created groups will receive all group email in their inbox by default
description:
We received feedback from our customers that in some cases users were missing the emails sent to groups that they were members of, now, when new Office 365 groups are created from Outlook, the default subscription option will be set to receiving all group email in the Inbox for group members. Previously, this was set to not subscribed.
This feature is available in Outlook on the web, and rolling out across Outlook.
Group owners and members can change this setting at any time.

title: SharePoint Online: site themes for classic sites
description: Microsoft will start enabling the modern site theming experience for all sites, classic and modern (group-connected) sites. It will now be possible for customers to apply the modern site themes on classic sites. A new site theming panel will be available, empowering site owners to easily apply one of the new themes to all pages of the site by selecting the theme of their choice.

title: Microsoft To-Do List Sharing
description: Sharing enables users to easily collaborate on common lists and tasks while on the go.

title: Office 365 Assistant for FastTrack customers
description:
Office 365 Assistant is a new chatbot in the Office 365 Admin center where users can ask questions across Office 365 workloads in a natural and conversational way, 24x7. Users will be able to quickly find relevant solutions and information, based on their initial query. 

This feature will be available for FastTrack customers, and will be rolled out in phases.

title: Yammer now supports Office 365 group naming policies
description: Admins will have the ability to set up rules around how an Office 365 group is named and will be able to block certain types of words from being included in a group name.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Lift 500 folder limit for shared mailboxes
description: Outlook has improved synchronization of folders by removing the 500 folder limit for shared mailboxes.

title: New "Recent Files" Experience on the Web
description: Now the list of recent files is shared across the Office 365 suite.

title: Ransomware Detection in ODC
description: Ransomware Detection is available in ODC

title: File viewers in Teams
description: OneDrive File viewers extended to  Teams

title: Customization of the Access Request Flow in OneDrive and SharePoint Online
description: We are making a few changes to the Access Request feature to make access requests easier to use and manage. First, owners can now customize the "Request Access" page by entering custom text to be displayed to users who want to request access. Second, owners can now easily see who is receiving access requests and customize the flow if desired.

title: Outlook for iOS: Personalized location suggestions and available conference rooms
description: Schedule a meeting or event with full address suggestions and available conference rooms in your Outlook calendar to support time to leave notifications and reduce the effort to find the right place to meet.

title: Outlook for Android:  Add Office Lens images
description: With Office Lens technology embedded in Outlook, easily add an image of a whiteboard, document or photo when composing an email.

title: Versioning settings in OneDrive for Business, Groups and team sites in SharePoint Online
description:
All SharePoint and OneDrive libraries will be set to retain a minimum of one hundred major versions. Existing libraries that have versioning enabled but are set to retain fewer than one hundred major versions will be updated to retain the new minimum. Libraries already set to retain one hundred or more major versions will not be affected, including those with the default setting of five hundred. 
 
With these changes, the Document Library Settings page will no longer support the ability to disable versioning or configure it to retain fewer than one hundred versions.

title: Request sign-off via Flow
description: Use a prebuilt Flow to get signoffs on data and documents anywhere in SharePoint and OneDrive

title: Microsoft To-Do is now Generally Available
description: Microsoft To-Do is now enabled by default for applicable customers and the To-Do tile is rolling out to customers enrolled in Standard Release as well.

title: Microsoft Listings
description: Getting your business listed online is a great way to be discovered by prospective customers, but it can be time consuming to set up your online presence, keep information like business hours up-to-date and monitor performance across sites. Microsoft Listings makes it easy to publish and manage your business listing on Facebook, Google, Bing and Yelp. When you update your business profile in Microsoft Listings, the changes automatically populate across Facebook, Google and Bing. And what’s more, you can monitor online views and reviews of your listings across sites from a single dashboard. This makes it easier to understand feedback from your customers and strengthen your online reputation. Microsoft Listings is available on the web. It is rolling out in preview over the next few weeks to Office 365 Business Premium subscribers in the U.S., U.K. and Canada, starting with those in the First Release program.

title: Microsoft Connections
description: Microsoft Connections is an email and referral marketing tool that helps companies drive new and repeat business

title: Office 365 Business center
description: The Office 365 Business center brings Bookings, Connections, Listings and Invoicing together in a central location—so you have easy access to your business apps and data. It features a unified dashboard where you can view key metrics from all the business apps, including total outstanding invoices, the number of appointments scheduled, the impressions across Facebook, Google, Bing and Yelp, and the number of new subscribers and sent campaigns. The Business center includes an activity feed, so you can see the details of what’s happening within each of the apps—making it easy to keep up-to-date on new customer appointments, invoices and payments being created or updated by the employees in your business. The activity feed also provides suggestions on what actions to take next, such as alerting you that a payment is overdue and it’s time to resend an invoice. Because the new business apps are built to work together, you don’t waste valuable time setting up connectors or transferring data manually. A contact in one business app is automatically recognized in another, so you don’t have to input data multiple times. As a business owner, you also have full control over who on your team gets access to which business apps and related information. Office 365 Business center is available on the web. It is rolling out in preview over the next few weeks to Office 365 Business Premium subscribers in the U.S., U.K. and Canada, starting with those in the First Release program.

title: Yammer Groups Activity Reporting in O365
description: Groups activity reporting for Yammer will soon be made available and viewable in the Office 365 usage reporting portal.

title: Yammer Skype for Business Integration
description: Yammer will leverage Skype's rich audio video communication capabilities.

title: Exchange Online Protection phishing protection
description: Admins will be able to add phishing levels similar to how they set up their spam levels

title: Outlook for Windows: Improvements to Contact Card
description: Updates to the Contact Card for people and groups, to make viewing contact details simpler and faster.

title: New in Access - Data Connector to Salesforce
description:
An addition to Access's rich data connectors portfolio - a new connector allowing users to import from and export to Salesforce data source.  
Salesforce connector in Access is available to customers with Office 365 ProPlus, E3, or E5 plans.

title: Outlook for Windows: Create appointments on Group calendars
description: Items added to a Group calendar will now act as Appointments by default, rather than Meetings. Appointments will appear on the calendar, but will not notifying all group members (i.e. send invites to their personal mailboxes). The user will have the option during event creation to check a box to notify the group members.

title: Customer Key in Office 365
description: Customer Key in Office 365 enables customers to provide and control their own encryption keys used to encrypt their Office 365 data at-rest.

title: New User Onboarding: Content Creation
description: As part of the on-going initiative to improve the Yammer onboarding experience, Yammer will introduce an interactive experience for users when they first get started on Yammer.  This will include a drop-down menu that highlights different use case examples to help a user with their initial post, and will be based on their functional area.  This may also roll out to existing users.

title: Yammer iPad Relaunch
description: As part of the ongoing initiative to improve the mobile experience on Yammer, the navigational structure, headers, and workflows for iPad will be redesigned.

title: Advanced Security Management - Yammer Activity Support
description: Anomaly and activity policies can be written to consider activities that are taken in Yammer

title: Advanced Security Management – Power BI Activity Support
description: Anomaly and activity policies can be written to consider activities that are taken in Power BI

title: Usage reports update: Reports Reader Administrator
description:
We continue to update the usage reporting experience to provide you with a complete picture of how your organization is using Office 365.
The new reports reader administrator is meant for those who are tasked with Office 365 reporting and data analysis as well as those driving usage and adoption within their organization. This new role gives a user access only to the usage reports in the Office 365 admin center and the data responsible for those reports under the Microsoft Graph API.

title: In-Product Language Auto-detection
description: To highlight localization capabilities in Yammer, users will get an in-product notification (light box pop-up) asking whether their language setting should be set to their browser language.

title: Microsoft Invoicing
description: Getting estimates and invoices out on time, tracking pending payments and processing payments quickly are critical to keep things running smoothly. But it can tedious and confusing to keep track of information in different systems of record or even on paper. Microsoft Invoicing helps you quickly create professional-looking estimates and invoices, so you get paid quickly. Microsoft Invoicing works with PayPal, so you can accept credit and debit cards online. A connector to QuickBooks lets you sync customer and catalogue data, and transfer invoicing information to your accountant. Microsoft Invoicing is available on the web, and on mobile apps for iOS and Android. It is rolling out in preview over the next few weeks to Office 365 Business Premium subscribers in the U.S., U.K. and Canada, starting with those in the First Release program.

title: Microsoft Teams - PowerShell configuration
description: Ability to configure and manage Microsoft Teams via PowerShell

title: Enhanced HIPAA protection in Office 365 DLP and Retention
description: More advanced and accurate detection of HIPAA content built-in to Office 365 DLP and Preservation policies.  You can now accurately detect and protect your organization’s HIPAA-related content, and you can customize the matching behavior to meet your organization’s specific requirements.

title: Large dictionary and unique match support in DLP policies and custom sensitive types
description: DLP will now support keyword dictionaries of 100,000+ terms, providing some out of the box (e.g. medical lexicons for HIPAA) or ability to create your own.  This will enhance your ability to discover sensitive content and enable you to better detect general or keyword-based content.

title: DLP policy tips in SharePoint Online and OneDrive for Business
description: We are enhancing DLP’s block access feature with a new option that allows organizations to block SharePoint Online and OneDrive for Business users right in the Share dialog – preventing them from exposing sensitive documents with guest or external users in real time.

title: Groups of conditions and configurable logical operators in DLP rules
description: Ability to group complex sets of conditions and choosing logical operators between and within them.  This will help you create more advanced policies and reduce the number of polices that you have.

title: Yammer Desktop Client
description: Yammer will develop a desktop client for Windows 7, 10 and Mac.

title: Outlook for Android - new Meetup calendar app
description: With Calendar Apps, you can connect your apps–Wunderlist, Facebook, Evernote, and now Meetup – to see all your tasks, events, and notes from your digital life in your Outlook calendar.

title: SharePoint: Site theming
description: Allows a site owner to quickly adjust the look and feel of their site, using default theme designs provided by Microsoft, or custom theme designs provided by customer's own IT. To access this feature per site, click the upper-right gear menu and then select: Change the look. You can then select from the available theme designs.

title: StaffHub: Enables Task Assignment & Tracking
description: Team members can now use StaffHub to create, assign and track tasks from co-workers and management- making it easier to manage and communicate work that comes up during shifts.

title: StaffHub: Integrate Schedule Details with Kronos
description: Microsoft StaffHub will support connections to Kronos, a leading provider of workforce management and human capital management cloud solutions. This integration will enable managers to import team schedule information from Kronos’s Workforce Central platform directly into Microsoft StaffHub. It will also allow employees to clock in/out from the app, and view their vacation accruals

title: StaffHub: Simplify Integrations with General APIs
description: Microsoft StaffHub plans to make available and support public APIs. Initially, these APIs will focus on shift and schedule data management at the team level. Stay tuned for more!

title: StaffHub: Benefit from Microsoft Flow Integration
description: Microsoft StaffHub plans to integrate with Microsoft Flow. This support will focus on automating basic workflows for teams, schedules and tasks - making it easier to digitize business process and activities.

title: Sway print and export
description: You can now print your Sway or export it to a Word or PDF format for offline viewing on the Sway web and Sway iOS app.

title: Sway: user-created templates
description: Office 365 subscribers will be able to create templates from their own Sways.

title: Improved Office 365 App Launcher
description: We’re updating the Office 365 App Launcher to help you get more done from anywhere in Office 365. Changes include a simplified apps list, access to recent documents, and improved navigation of company-wide apps and services.

title: New Authenticated Office 365 Home Page
description: The redesigned Office 365 Home Page at http://www.office.com offers improved access to files and applications from across your organization. The new design includes recent, pinned, and shared online documents, the ability to easily create a new document and to start collaborating, quick access to your SharePoint sites and OneDrive folders, as well as improved company-wide search.

title: Office 365 App Gallery
description: We’re introducing a new way to explore and understand all the apps in your Office 365 subscription with the Office 365 App Gallery. This additional view is accessed via the App Launcher and Office 365 Homepage to help users learn about the apps that are available to them.

title: Shared calendars on mobile phones
description: Newly added shared calendars now sync to your mobile phone. Calendars accepted from a calendar sharing invitation will start sync'ing to mobile phones. From Outlook on iOS & Android, you can share a calendar, or accept a new calendar sharing invitation. For meeting invite, delegates will see if the invitation is for them or for a delegated calendar.

title: Visio Online GA
description: Visio Online is the new way to create Visio diagrams in a web browser. With refreshed user interface, Visio Online will let you create, edit, and share flowcharts, relationships, and other basic diagrams in your browser.

title: US Government: New capabilities in Firstline/Kiosk license
description: We are adding Office Online and OneDrive for Business capabilities for Office 365 Government F1 and Office 365 Government K2 customers. With Office Online you can view, edit, and share Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and OneNote documents from within a browser, and with this update, each user will receive 2GB of OneDrive for Business personal cloud storage. This update is for Office 365 US Government Community (GCC). Teams, StaffHub, Flow, and PowerApps will be introduced at a later date once these services meet the compliance requirements.

title: LinkedIn information in Microsoft apps
description:
If your organization has received an early release update, you can see information from public LinkedIn profiles in your Microsoft apps and services. 

If you connect your LinkedIn and Microsoft accounts, you may see additional LinkedIn profile information. For example, when you hover over a person's image in Outlook, you can see LinkedIn information about that person. Over time, you can also expect your networking experience on LinkedIn to be improved and enriched with data from your Microsoft account when data leaves the Online Services to LinkedIn. Not available for United States Government customers, and organizations with Exchange Online mailboxes hosted in Australia, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, South Korea, United Kingdom, Japan, and South Africa. Support for these mailbox locations is coming soon.

title: New Office 365 Message Encryption Capabilities
description: As part of our integrated information protection investments we are releasing rich new capabilities in Office 365 Message Encryption that protect and control your sensitive emails.

title: Microsoft Teams on iOS: Meeting join capabilities
description: Microsoft Teams' iOS app will be updated to enable users to join their meetings from the mobile app, including audio, video, and viewing shared desktop

title: Microsoft 365 Business - announcement
description: Microsoft 365 Business is designed for small- to medium-sized businesses with up to 300 users and integrates Office 365 Business Premium with tailored security and management features from Windows 10 and Enterprise Mobility + Security. It offers services to empower employees, safeguard the business and simplify IT management. Microsoft 365 Business:- Helps companies achieve more together by better connecting employees, customers and suppliers.- Empowers employees to get work done from anywhere, on any device.- Protects company data across devices with always-on security.- Simplifies the set-up and management of employee devices and services with a single IT console. Microsoft 365 Business will be available in public preview on August 2, 2017. It will become generally available on a worldwide basis in the fall (CYQ3) of 2017, priced at US $20 per user, per month.

title: Improved search and auto detection of image types in OneDrive
description: We’re improving the search capability in OneDrive that will autodetect new content such as images, focusing on the objects most likely used at work. For example, when a picture is taken of a whiteboard and it's uploaded into OneDrive, OneDrive will automatically identify that the image is a whiteboard, and this image will appear in the content listed as ‘whiteboard’. Other examples of work-related items that will be auto detected and searched for include: receipts, screenshots, envelopes, vector graphics, and x-ray film.

title: Microsoft Forms new grading feature
description: Show correct choices once respondents submit their answers to your quizzes.

title: Microsoft Forms new grading feature
description: Show respondents the correct choices once they submit their answers to your quiz.

title: Message Center Weekly Digest - General Availability
description: By popular request, we’ve introduced a weekly digest so that you can review Message Center communications via email. Important notifications from the Office 365 team should be available where you do work – your inbox. The weekly digest capability is available to Office 365 admins who are configured for First Release. In September, the Message Center Weekly Digest will start rolling out in Standard Release. Don’t forget, Message Center can be accessed in the Admin Center, Admin Mobile App, and Service Communications API, as well as the Message Center Weekly Digest.

title: Yammer:  Push Notification Subscription
description: Users will have the option to subscribe for push notifications in their Yammer Groups.

title: Client Access Rules for Exchange Online
description: Client Access Rules help you to control access to your Exchange Online organization based upon the properties of the client or the access request type of the client. The rules are employed to block the ability of a client to use a particular protocol, application, service, or resource based upon username, source IP address or range, the authentication type, or a recipient attribute.

title: Cross premises permissions for "send on behalf of"
description: The feature will enable specific mailbox delegation scenarios (send on behalf of) between Exchange Online and Exchange on-premises. Through this update customers can manage delegates for cloud mailboxes and flow these delegates back to Exchange on-premises, enabling on-premises users to be delegates of cloud mailboxes. This reduces complexity of migrating mailboxes to the cloud by removing one of the tasks of mapping the delegate family as part of onboarding planning. Future work not included in this enhancement may include other cross premises mailbox permissions including (Send As, Full Mailbox Access, Full Mailbox Access with AutoMap).

title: MyAnalytics: Activity and group trends and network refresh
description: MyAnalytics will now provide insights into your collaboration with your top Office 365 groups. Understand where your time is going by initiative, project or hierarchical team to prioritize and align to your priorities. This will include an update to the network section of the MyAnalytics dashboard that will provide a time map of your collaboration time across colleagues and groups. This update will also include the ability to understand trends over longer periods of time for the core metrics such as time in meetings, email, focus, etc.

title: OneDrive - Per Group Sharing Controls
description:
Per-group sharing controls is a new Office 365 feature for OneDrive for Business and SharePoint Online. This feature allows you to limit external sharing in your organization to only users in selected security groups. We'll begin rolling this feature out in June, in two phases. First, you will notice a new setting that allows users to specify a set of security groups that are allowed to share to authenticated external users and via anonymous links. Second, another option will appear that allows admins to specify a setof security groups that are allowed to share to authenticated external users only. 
We'll be gradually rolling this out to First Release customers in early June, and the roll out will be completed by the end of July.

title: Call Analytics in Open Preview
description: Call Quality Reporting Tool

title: Document Preview for Safe Attachments
description: Document preview will enable you to view a document attachment contents while the document is being scanned by the Safe Attachments attachment detonation technology.

title: Outlook for Android: Scheduling Assistant
description: Inspired by the well-loved scheduling assistant of Outlook on Windows, Mac, iOS and the web, you will be able to see your coworkers’ availability and find a time that works for everyone when scheduling a meeting.

title: Outlook for Android: Add and edit contacts
description: With our latest update, you can now add and edit contacts for Outlook.com and Office 365 accounts. To create a new contact from scratch, simply go to the People tab and tap the  ‘+’ sign. You can also add a new contact directly from a message or event by tapping the name of a person and then ‘Add Contact’, or by using the search bar in the People tab to find and add contacts from your company directory.

title: Personalized Search in SharePoint Home
description: See personalized results as soon as you click into the Search box that are informed by the intelligence of the Microsoft Graph. Locates expertise by searching for skills, projects and interests and see their people card and extended panel  directly from SharePoint home.

title: Outlook for iOS: Set status for calendar events
description: Set and show events on your calendar as free, busy, tentative, out of office and private.

title: New in Access - Data Connector to Microsoft Dynamics
description:
An addition to Access's rich data connectors portfolio - a new connector allowing users to import from and export to Microsoft Dynamics 365.  
Microsoft Dynamics connector in Access is available to customers with Office 365 ProPlus, E3, or E5 plans.

title: Outlook for Android: Draft sync
description: Sync drafts between different versions of Outlook, so you can start a message in one place and finish and send in another.

title: OneDrive Files on Demand – Preview via Windows Insider Builds
description: With OneDrive Files On-Demand- Preview, you can access all your files in the cloud without using storage space on your device. You don’t have to change the way you work, because all your files—even online files—can be seen in File Explorer and work just like every other file on your device. Furthermore, you’re covered in both your home and professional life, since it works with your personal and work OneDrive, as well as your SharePoint Online team sites. Available this summer for Windows Insiders.

title: New Sharing Controls from Mac Finder
description: OneDrive and Sharepoint Users can now have the same sharing experience from the Mac Finder as that of Web .This includes sharing with Anyone, People in your tenant and specific people inside or outside your organization.

title: Offline folders in OneDrive Mobile App (iOS)
description: With this roll out , users can now take and entire folders for offline viewing on their mobile phones, along with individual files.

title: Outlook Add-ins for Android
description: Your favorite apps right inside email so you can accomplish tasks quickly without leaving Outlook.

title: OneDrive integration with Microsoft Flow
description: Microsoft flow helps you to make repetitive tasks easy with workflow automation. With OneDrive and Flow integration user can now automate tasks by integrating their favorite apps with OneDrive

title: Updates to "Shared with me" view - external content
description: OneDrive for Business now gives you easy access to files and folders shared from external partners. When a partner shares a file with you from anywhere in Office 365 (including OneDrive, SharePoint, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote),it appears in your Shared With Me view, so you've always got your important documents on hand across all your devices

title: Updates to Admin control for internal/ external sharing
description: We now offer tenant admins the ability to restrict both external sharing and sharing via anonymous links to users in specified security groups. Furthermore, when admins choose to prevent external users from re-sharing content they don't own, we have made changes to ensure that external users are unable to enumerate other external users inside of a site collection.

title: New Sharing Controls from Windows Explorer
description: OneDrive and Sharepoint Users can now have similar sharing experience from Windows explorer as that of Web .This includes sharing with Anyone, People in your tenant and specific people inside or outside your organization.

title: Multi page scan from Mobile
description: Using the OneDrive mobile app you can seamlessly take a photo, convert it to a PDF,and store it in OneDrive. Till date we support only single page PDF scan from the OneDrive Mobile app. With this feature OneDrive will support multi pages can from a mobile app

title: SharePoint mobile app for Android - on-premises access
description: You will be able to log into your on-premises SharePoint Server environment from within the SharePoint mobile app for Android - giving you access to all of your sites within your firewall, and if you are leveraging SharePoint Online, the app will provide access to all your sites from both on-premises and online in Office 365.

title: SharePoint mobile app for Android: create news
description: Add your own news stories right from your Android device. Simply click + Add from the News section on a team site, type a title, add body text and format it. You can also add image(s) and embed documents. And then click Publish. You and your peers will see the story appear across the news service as a recent story – on SharePoint home in Office 365, within the personalized News tab of the SharePoint apps, and on the team site itself. That’s news reach – ensuring you have an effective, automated megaphone to amplify your news.

title: SharePoint - News: Notifications
description: On-device notifications appear when important news items are published "to you" based on the relevancy of Microsoft Graph - which now contains News as a common content type that is indexed and applicable to what is relevant to you based on who you work with and what you and they are working on.

title: CoAuthor with nearby users on the Sway iOS app
description: Sway iOS authors can find coauthors near their current proximity to work on Sways together.  Office 365 commercial users have the ability to lock down presence to only those within their organization.

title: Sway previews in emails
description: Show a preview of your Sway when you share it to others over email

title: eDiscovery Export to compressed folder (zip file)
description: Provides an alternate export format that reduces truncation of files paths that exceed 260 characters

title: Microsoft Teams improvements for Class and Staff Notebook
description: Ability to view Class and Staff Notebooks in full-screen with full notebook structure. Ability to access notebook settings within Teams with 'Edit in Browser' support.

title: Office Lens: Multi page scan on Android
description: With this release, our users can seamlessly scan more than one page at a time, bundle as a PDF file and share. Powered by our Optical Character Recognition (OCR) capabilities, text from multiple pages can be extracted and exported to a Word document. Office Lens also allows for users to save it as a PowerPoint or a OneNote file. Users can also choose to save to OneDrive.

title: StaffHub: Stay Connected with Outlook Integration
description: Team members can access important company news or announcements made in Outlook directly in StaffHub - allowing Firstline Workers to stay up to date and connected to the organization.

title: SharePoint mobile app: Me tab
description: The Me experience within the SharePoint mobile apps delivers a single place (tab) to catch up on the important collaboration going on around you.  You can easily pick up where you left off with confidence that you haven’t missed anything important. The Me experience will focus on bringing a “Recent” and a “Save for later” experience to the SharePoint mobile for Android and iOS.

title: Microsoft To-Do for iPad
description: Manage your to-dos and Outlook tasks on the go with the new Microsoft To-Do for iPad app. Now available in Preview.

title: Microsoft To-Do for Android Tablet
description: Manage your to-dos and Outlook tasks on the go with the new Microsoft To-Do for Android Tablet app. Now available in Preview.

title: Audio Conferencing Preview in Microsoft Teams
description: Audio conferencing is a new Office365 feature that is now available in public preview in Microsoft Teams.

title: Microsoft Teams in Japan Datacenter
description: Ability to have Japan data residency for core customer data at rest, plus failover and disaster recovery

title: Microsoft Teams in Australia datacenter
description: Ability to have Australia data residency for core customer data at rest, plus failover and disaster recovery

title: Microsoft Teams in Canada datacenter
description: Ability to have Canada data residency for core customer data at rest, plus failover and disaster recovery

title: Microsoft Teams Availability for US Gov
description: Microsoft Teams is the chat-based workspace in Office 365.  It is a smarter way of working as an essential hub for your chats, content, people and tools to keep the team connected. Microsoft Teams will be made available to Office 365 US Government Community (GCC) subscribers as soon necessary compliance is achieved.

title: Advanced Security Management – EU Datacenter Expansion
description: Advanced Security Management will be hosted in the Microsoft EU datacenter region

title: Microsoft Teams - UK datacenter
description: Ability to have UK data residency for core customer data at rest, plus failover and disaster recovery

title: Microsoft Teams - Support for larger teams
description: Support for larger team sizes, up to 2,500

title: DLP availability in sovereign cloud environments
description: Office 365 DLP capabilities will become available in sovereign cloud environments - Office 365 Germany and Office 365 operated by 21Vianet (China).

title: Usage reports update: new report for Microsoft Teams
description: New reports in the Office 365 usage dashboard. We continue to add a new usage report on Microsoft Teams to provide you with a complete picture of how your organization is using Office 365.

title: Service Health Dashboard Update: email notifications (preview)
description:
We're adding enhancements to the Service Health Dashboard in the Office 365 admin center: 
Stay informed through your preferred channel—The new Service health dashboard will enable you to sign up for notifications via email so that you can monitor the service and track issues through the channel you prefer.

title: Migration of Yammer Weekly Digest
description: Users who have currently signed up for the Yammer weekly digest will be migrated to the Yammer daily digest.

title: Outlook for Windows: Focused Inbox expansion
description: Focused Inbox will now be available to all users on the Monthly update channel for Office 365 ProPlus. Previously, Focused Inbox required that modern authentication also be enabled in order for it to be visible in Outlook for Windows. That requirement is being removed. Users on the Semi-Annual Channel (Targeted) will receive Focused Inbox in the March 2018 update for that channel.

title: Intelligent Discovery for Windows Phone
description: From the OneDrive app, Discover view uses the Office Graph to suggest relevant and trending files from Office 365. The Discover view suggests content that is most relevant for each person based on the work they are doing and the people with whom they engage.

title: SharePoint pages in Microsoft Teams
description: Easily add SharePoint pages as a new tab in the Microsoft Teams channel interface. Now you can access the dynamic, data-driven pages you've created for your team sites and communication sites and surface them right in the context of the chat-based work space of Microsoft Teams.

title: SharePoint - predictive indexing for lists and libraries
description: Over the coming months, we will be phasing in automatic indexing and performance optimization to improve performance of large lists and reduce or eliminate problems in large scale lists.

title: Custom forms with PowerApps
description: Use PowerApps to design in-browser custom list/library forms

title: Power BI web part
description: Add any Power BI report to any SharePoint page.

title: Outlook for iOS: search improvements
description: A new, more intelligent search in Outlook for We've made search front and center, giving it its own tab in our new simplified navigation bar. No matter where you are in the app, whatever you're looking for will be just one tap away: the venue of tonight's concert, your flight's exact departure time, or that file your boss needed in her inbox 5 minutes ago. Personalized suggestion will make it easier and faster to search, with less typing. Search will also return both email and contact information and feature new filters to help you find what you need fast.

title: Intelligent Scan via photo
description: Updated UX to do smart cropping of items being scanned. Streamlined capture flow.

title: Photo intelligence: Auto tagging and OCR
description: Images in OneDrive for Business are automatically tagged and scanned for text, enriching the search index. Now you can search photos in based on tag, text (OCR), and location.

title: Announcement emails to pending users
description: Pending users in a group will be sent an email if the group admin post's an Announcement.

title: Office 365 administration – support for “Azure Active Directory Administrative Units” (preview)
description: We continue to update the Office 365 management experience to make it more efficient for you to manage Office 365. To enable you to better delegate permissions, we’re adding support for “Azure Active Directory Administrative Units” to the main Office 365 admin center. This will allow scoped administrator accounts to use the Office 365 Admin center and only see and manage users within their assigned scope(s).

title: Advanced eDiscovery: Analyze non-Office 365 data
description: Import data from outside of Office 365 and analyze it directly with Office 365 Advanced eDiscovery.

title: Office 365 business apps are generally available
description: Office 365 Business apps including Microsoft Connections, Microsoft Listings, Microsoft Invoicing, and Office 365 Business center are generally available. They will be rolling out to all Office 365 Business Premium and Microsoft 365 Business customers over the next few weeks in US, UK, and Canada.

title: OneDrive for Android - Support for on-premise files in SharePoint Server
description: OneDrive for Android now supports accessing your on-premise files stored on SharePoint Server 2013 and 2016

title: Files On-Demand
description: With files on Demand users can access all their files in the cloud without using their device storage space.

title: Publishing Announcements on Mobile
description: Yammer will add the ability to post announcements from mobile on Android.

title: Microsoft Bookings now available to E3, E5 users
description: Microsoft Bookings will now be available to E3 and E5 users starting 11/07/2017. It will be available through a free add-on subscription - Business Apps (free) - that admins can add to their existing subscriptions.

title: Column formatter
description: Information workers will be able to add custom format code in JSON format to any column in a list or library, allowing for conditional formatting, enriched visual presentation, or additional interactivity.

title: Group insights in Yammer
description: Yammer will enable users of groups to view in-product reports of daily and weekly user engagement.

title: Reassign Sways to another user via PowerShell
description: Office 365 administrators will be able to use a PowerShell script to reassign Sways that belonged to an account that has been deleted from the Azure Active Directory to another user in the organization.

title: Basic branding in Sway
description: Authors will be able to apply a specific brand color to their Sway.

title: StaffHub: New Simplified Web Experience
description: Team members can now take advantage of an updated StaffHub web experience - making it easier use and to have a great experience no matter how you access StaffHub.

title: Office 365 ATP Safe Links for Intra-Org Emails
