description: Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection Safe Links for internal emails will enable time of click protection and functionality of Safe Links for intra-org emails.  This will protect end users from malicious links in emails that are sent between users in the same organization.

title: Announcements on Mobile - iOS
description: Yammer will enable users to publish announcements on iOS mobile client.

title: Azure AD : Workday inbound HR integration: GA
description: Workday (HR SaaS application) employee records can be imported as user accounts in Azure AD, and then written back to on-premises Active Directory

title: SharePoint web part: updates for rich text editing (RTE)
description: The SharePoint rich text editor (RTE) web part is being updated to give you greater control for how your text appears. From the simple command bar within the web part, select the ellipses to display the broader set of choices in the edit pane, like font colors and highlights, plus table creation and editing.

title: OneDrive Sync Engine End User Tutorial
description: New users of OneDrive that set up the OneDrive sync client will receive a one-time tutorial on uploading files to OneDrive, accessing their content via the Mobile Application, and sharing their files with others.

title: OneDrive for iOS - File previewers
description: OneDrive for iOS creates crisp thumbnails and supports large previews of over 130+ file types, including Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, RAW, 3D objects, and high-precision DICOM. OneDrive lets you open, view, and share all of your files without leaving the app

title: Microsoft Teams in Office 365 Education updates to Assignments experience
description: Ability to create an assignment with a OneNote page and pull up OneNote page assignments in the quick grading view. Ability to create Teams assignments, plus grading, all from within OneNote desktop app. Advanced assignments notifications, collaboration and search. Initiate work using Office apps in context of the assignment submission flow. Ability to switch into full screen view while working on assignments.

title: Updated SharePoint team site home page
description: Group-connected SharePoint team sites in Office 365 currently have two web parts on the homepage:  News and Activity. This update adjusts the home page to start with a default of four: News, Quick Links, Activity, and Documents.  This change will not affect team sites that were previously created. Only new sites will receive the new homepage. And as you can today, site owners can add and remove web parts and adjust section layouts once the site is established. We will begin rolling this feature out to First Release organizations in early December 2017, and then out to Standard Release organizations shortly thereafter. As the roll out progresses, you may experience variance in the availability of the new site features when you create  new homepages. When the roll out is completed, new homepages will only appear with four web parts.

title: ATP For SharePoint Online, OneDrive for Business, and Teams
description: The security of ATP will now extend to SharePoint Online, OneDrive for Business, and Microsoft Teams.  ATP now helps secure a broader set of workloads in Office 365.  Gain protection from advanced threats in more of your productivity workloads.

title: SharePoint - Start new page from existing page
description: Make it easy to create a new page in SharePoint modeled after an existing page that resembles the structure of the new page you want to create. It saves times and enables easy replication based on existing content.

title: SharePoint Online - promote a page or news
description: After you create a news article or page in SharePoint, you'll want to then share it with others and increase the visibility on your new content. When you promote a news article or page you can send it via email, grab a link to put into a discussion or promote it as a top-level navigation item of your site.

title: Release Timelines on Roadmap
description: The Office 365 Roadmap (roadmap.office.com) now includes release timelines for each feature. Estimated dates represent when the capability will begin rolling out, and admins can still rely on the Message Center for targeted communications when action is required.

title: Microsoft Whiteboard Preview
description: Microsoft Whiteboard is a freeform digital canvas where people, ideas, and content can come together for creative collaboration. The app is built for anyone who engages in creative, freeform thinking before getting to their final output. It’s designed for teams that need to ideate, iterate, and work together both in person and remotely, and across multiple devices.  The Microsoft Whiteboard Preview is currently available in all English versions of Windows 10, and will roll out to additional languages in the coming months. The app is free to use for anyone with a Windows 10 device, but one participant with an Office 365 personal, work, or school account is needed for multi-party collaboration.  The Microsoft Whiteboard Preview will be turned off by default for Office 365 work users, and IT Admins will need to turn it on within the Office 365 Admin Center.

title: Microsoft Teams - Import Contacts from Skype for Business
description: This is one of the SfB messaging capabilities coming to Teams, providing the ability to import contacts from Skype for Business.

title: Migrate public folders to an Office 365 group
description: You can now use a batch migration process to move your public folders (both online and on-premises) to an Office 365 group.

title: GIFs on iOS
description: Users will now be able to post GIFs to Yammer threads and posts directly from the Yammer mobile app.

title: Microsoft Teams - Edge, Chrome Browser Support for meetings
description: This is a new meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Support to join meetings and view screen sharing without a plug-in.

title: Microsoft Teams- Application Sharing
description: This is one of the collaborative meetings capabilities coming to Teams.

title: Office 365 ATP Safe Links for iOS and Android Platforms
description: Now the power of Office 365 ATP Safe Links extends coverage to iOS and Android Platforms.   Users can now enjoy time of click protection from potentially malicious links for their mobile devices which use iOS or Android.  The feature is auto-enabled for customers who already have the feature enabled on their desktop devices.

title: Exchange Hybrid Configuration Wizard for GCC High
description: The Exchange Online hybrid configuration wizard (HCW) has been updated to support the Office 365 GCC High environment.

title: Automatic Message Center Translations
description: We are making changes to the language translations in Message Center: as per customer feedback, the language of Message Center will be automatically set based on language selected for the admin portal. The Translation button in Message Center will still exist for translation to a different language.

title: Allowing a dot(.) in the group alias when creating a group
description: You can now add a dot (.) or more to a group name. Dots cannot be the first or last character and consecutive dots are not allowed. You can currently see this update in Outlook on the web, iOS, Android, and admin centers while creating or editing a group. Support for Outlook for Windows will roll out soon.

title: Office 365 Admin: Security and Compliance Reports Alternate Access
description: The links to Protection and Auditing reports in Office365 Admin portal are being replaced with alternate access locations in Security and Compliance center and Exchange Admin center. We will be removing the links for Protection and Auditing reports from the Office 365 Admin center - Reports navigation pane beginning mid November 2017. Instead of using the admin center links, administrators can now access the Protection reports from the Security and Compliance center and the Auditing reports from the Exchange Admin center.

title: Large Address Aware support in Outlook 2016 may affect some COM add-ins
description: Build 16.0.8528.2147 (Version 1709) of the 32-bit version of Outlook 2016 for Windows has been updated to be Large Address Aware (LAA). This increases the maximum address space available to Outlook from 2 GB to 4 GB when it is running on a 64-bit version of Windows. This is key to improved graphics rendering in Outlook when using newer displays that support higher screen resolutions. While LAA Outlook has been extensively tested, there is the possibility that some third-party or in-house developed Outlook COM Add-ins may experience issues with the change. Only 32-bit, 1709 versions of Outlook 2016 or later and running on a 64-bit version of Windows may be impacted.  For details refer to https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Large-Address-Aware-in-Outlook-2016-ea0913e4-2917-4456-b0ea-935dbd57ef02?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US

title: First Release renamed Targeted Release
description: First Release will be renamed Targeted Release. There are no other changes in commitment or configuration for Targeted Release. Customers do not need to do anything to prepare for this change.

title: Microsoft Stream: Deployed to Australia, Brazil, India, Japan and UK data centers
description: Newly created Microsoft Stream customers whose AAD tenant country is in or near Australia, Brazil, India, Japan or UK will now have their Microsoft Stream tenant created in those respective data centers.

title: Microsoft Stream: Storage usage details
description: Ability for Microsoft Stream admins to see how much video storage quota is available and being used by their organization.

title: Microsoft Stream: Create videos in PowerPoint and publish to Stream
description: With the PowerPoint "Recording" tab you can create a video from PowerPoint including, slides, screen recording, inking, webcam, and videos. When you are done you can now publish your PowerPoint as a video directly into Microsoft Stream.

title: Microsoft Stream: Edit people timeline for video
description: Video owners can merge or hide detected people shown in the people timeline for a video.

title: Microsoft Stream: Purchase additional video storage
description: Admins can purchase additional Microsoft Stream video storage in 500 GB packs to add to their tenant's pooled Stream video storage limits.

title: Outlook for Mac:  Create Tables in Message Body
description: Insert a table in your email body, just as effortlessly as you can in Microsoft Word.

title: Outlook for Mac:  Text size options
description: Increase or decrease the font size in your sidebar, message list, and reading pane. But don't stop there! Choose the default font size for messages you compose and receive.

title: Compliance Manager Preview
description: During the GDPR T-6 Months webcast we will go through a demo of Compliance Manager which is our tool to help assess your compliance posture against the evolving regulations and also provides recommended actions to improve your data protection capabilities.

title: Forms Web Part
description: Add Microsoft Forms - submission and results - to any SharePoint page.

title: Flow for OneDrive
description: Build and launch custom Flows directly from the OneDrive command bar on the web.

title: OneDrive sync for IRM encrypted libraries
description: Use the OneDrive next gen sync client (NGSC) to synchronize files in SharePoint libraries encrypted using IRM.

title: Power BI Content Pack for Project Online
description: Unlock insight from Project Online to help manage projects, portfolios and resources. Import and analyze data from Project Online in Power BI. The content pack is designed to help you quickly connect to your Project Online tenant in Office 365 and download a variety of data to visually explore and monitor all the key aspects of your project, portfolios and resources through 13 visually rich report pages.

title: Microsoft Teams - Teams Interop Policies
description: This is one of the Office 365 IT Pro capabilities coming to Teams. Administrators will be able to set a wide variety of policies which govern Inter/Op between Teams and Skype for Business.

title: Microsoft Teams - Blind Transfer
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Blind transfer allows a call to be sent to another extension immediately.

title: Microsoft Teams - Call Blocking
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for Call Blocking.

title: Microsoft Teams - Call Forwarding
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. This provides support for users to configure call-forwarding for their account.

title: Microsoft Teams - Caller ID masking
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for caller ID masking.

title: Microsoft Teams - e911 Support
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for e911 services in Microsoft Teams.

title: Microsoft Teams - Extension Dialing
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. This feature adds support for Extension Dialing to Teams.

title: Microsoft Teams - Hold
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. This feature adds putting a call on hold and the ability to resume the call.

title: Microsoft Teams - Multi-call Handling
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for the handling of multiple simultaneous calls.

title: Microsoft Teams - Simultaneous Ringing
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. This configurable feature allows for more than one phone to ring when there is an in-coming call.

title: Microsoft Teams - Speed dial
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. This features provides speed dialing to Teams users.

title: Microsoft Teams - Suggested Contacts
description: This is one of the SfB messaging and calling capabilities coming to Teams. This feature will intelligently suggest contacts for you.

title: Microsoft Teams - Voicemail
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. This feature provides Voicemail with transcription and playback options.

title: Microsoft Teams - Translate user input to standard format phone number
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams.  Enable the automatic data normalization of user data entry.

title: Microsoft Teams - Call Quality Diagnostic Portal
description: This is one of the SfB calling IT Pro capabilities coming to Teams. It provides a portal UI to allow administrators to evaluate call quality with possible corrective actions.

title: Microsoft Teams - TTY Support
description: This is one of the SfB Calling capabilities coming to Teams. This feature adds TTY device Support.

title: Microsoft Teams - Client Support
description: This is one of the SfB IT Pro capabilities coming to Teams. Client support for Windows, Mac, Edge, iOS and Android.

title: Microsoft Teams - SfB-Teams Calling
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams. Support for Skype for Business to Teams Calling.

title: Microsoft Teams - Message Retention Policies
description: This is one of the Office 365 IT Pro capabilities coming to Teams. Administrators will be able to set policies for message retention.

title: Microsoft Teams - Audio Conferencing in over 90 countries
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Microsoft Audio Conferencing enables attendees to Join the audio portion of a meeting by dialing a PSTN phone number and entering a conference passcode.

title: Microsoft Teams - Mute Other Participants
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. This will enable the muting of other participants during a meeting. Especially effective for meetings with a large number of attendees.

title: Microsoft Teams - Enable Existing Calling Plan Support
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams and enables existing calling plan support in Microsoft Teams. This still requires country level support for Calling Plan.

title: Microsoft Teams - Skype for Business Interop with Persistent Chat
description: This is one of the SfB messaging capabilities coming to Teams that enables a Teams user to chat with other users who are using Skype for business (online or on-prem). This requires Teams user's account to be hosted online.

title: Microsoft Teams - Interactive Troubleshooting
description: This is one of the SfB meeting capabilities coming to Teams. Interactive troubleshooting refers to user-facing diagnostics to give additional advice and suggestions based upon detecting scenarios that might be impacting meeting quality. The first scenario provides the ability for attendees to detect when they are mute but are talking. Teams will let users know when that is happening and recommend going off mute so others can hear. Other scenarios will be supported as well.

title: Microsoft Teams- eDiscovery Enhancements (calling)
description: This is one of the SfB calling capabilities coming to Teams and will include a number of eDiscovery Enhancements.

title: Microsoft Teams - Enable Call Quality Analytics
description: This is one of the SfB meetings IT Pro capabilities coming to Teams and provides support for Call quality User Analytics in Microsoft Teams.

title: Use Microsoft To-Do for Web with your work or school account
description: Microsoft To-Do, available in Preview, now supports signing in with your work and school account.

title: Microsoft To-Do is now Commercially Available
description: Microsoft To-Do which has been available in preview since April 2017, has been added to applicable Office 365 subscriptions. Please see your Admin Center messages for more information.

title: Multi-factor and federated authentication support for connecting to the Office 365 Security & Compliance Center through PowerShell
description: Users who use PowerShell to connect to Office 365 Security & Compliance center can now use multi-factor authentication for additional layer of security. In addition, companies that have on-prem directory can now use federated authentication in PowerShell to connect to Office 365 Security & Compliance Center.

title: SharePoint Online: custom site designs
description: It will now be possible for customers to create and upload custom site designs, stored in a central, tenant-level gallery - applicable both for team and communication sites. A user would see the custom site design as a choice during site creation after they click "Create site" from SharePoint home in Office 365 and select their site type.

title: SharePoint Online: custom site themes
description: It will now be possible for customers to create and upload custom site themes, stored in a central, tenant-level gallery - applicable both for team and communication sites. A user would see the custom site themes as a choice when they are on the site they wish to adjust, click the gear icon in the upper-right, and then choose "Change the look.".

title: SharePoint Online: custom site designs and site themes gallery
description: It will now be possible for admins to create and upload custom site designs and custom site themes, storing them in a central, tenant-level gallery - applicable for use with both team and communication sites.

title: SharePoint Online: updated site usage page
description:
We have established a new, dedicated page for Site usage in SharePoint Online. Previously, a site owner would see site usage information at the top of the Site contents page. We have moved that analytics portion to a dedicated page. The Site contents page maintains focus on access and management of content (lists, libraries, pages, etc.). And to gain insights into how your site is being used via this new Site usage page. When you are visiting a team or communication site, click the gear button in the upper-right portion of the site, and select Site contents. Once on the Site contents page, click the Site usage button in the top-right action bar. 

We are announcing the addition of additional insights at the site level (most viewed and most unique viewers, trending content, historical views), and at the page level (the number of comments and likes, plus views and viewer counts).

title: SharePoint news - aggregation into Microsoft Teams chat
description: It is possible to publish news articles within team sites, and when you associate a Microsoft Teams channel for the group, you'll see each published article automatically flow into the chat workspace as a new thread of the discussion. This helps with both awareness of team news, plus it helps as a discussion starter for topics being pushed as important news to all team members.

title: SharePoint news - newsletter digest email
description: Users will be able to quickly create a clean newsletter by selecting the desired news articles they wish to rollup into a consolidated email, to be sent to the users/groups of their choosing. The news articles appear as article previews with thumbnail and a glimpse at the body text of each article, with of course links to take a reader to the full article they are interested to read in full.

title: SharePoint web part: Microsoft Forms
description: Site owners and members will now be able to create simple surveys using Microsoft Forms and then embed the form for site and page visitors to fill out and submit.

title: SharePoint web part: Office 365 group calendar
description: Team site owners and members can now embed their Office 365 group calendar directly within SharePoint pages and news. You would manage the group calendar items from within the Outlook interface, and then the group calendar web part enables visibility from the SharePoint user interface alongside the context of the site pages and information.

title: StaffHub: Available in Select SMB SKUs
description: Microsoft StaffHub is coming to select business SKUs including Office 365 Business Premium and Microsoft 365 Business - allowing customers of all sizes to empower their Firstline Workers.

title: StaffHub: Extending Security with Intune
description: Microsoft StaffHub will benefit from Intune and Mobile App Management - helping to extend security across every endpoint and employee.

title: StaffHub: Supports in-app clock in / out
description: Team members can now use StaffHub to clock in and out -  providing a simple to use and GPS-enabled tool to streamline time and attendance.

title: Outlook.com beta includes Calendar and People
description: Continuing with the Outlook.com beta, the new Calendar UI will rollout for Outlook.com.

title: eDiscovery Case Holds, Search and Export modernization
description: eDiscovery case holds, search and export UI modernization to matches the user experience of the Security & Compliance Center, also includes elimination of pop-up windows in the user experience. At the same time the content search experience will be refreshed to align to the case search experience.

title: Sway logo support
description: Office 365 users can now add their logo to their Sways

title: Bookings user level controls
description: Office 365 Business Premium subscriptions will get admin level controls to grant/restrict Bookings access at the user level. Rollout will start with First Release customers.

title: Outlook on the web: Drag and drop emails into group mailbox
description: Groups in Outlook users can drag and drop their emails from their inbox to the group mailbox in Outlook on the web.

title: Office 365 Message Center Improvements
description: When new services are available, capabilities change, or admin action is required, Microsoft posts notifications in the Office 365 Message Center. The tenant specific information can be found in the Admin Center via browser, the Admin Mobile App, Service Communication API, and emails. Until recently, formatting was simple text, but starting now, Message Center communications can include videos, images, and rich text.

title: Message Center "Major Updates"
description: Major Updates to the Office 365 services require administrator attention. They impact the way users engage with the software, and Office 365 customers need to be aware of the plans, the general timing, and have control to ensure that information is protected. In the weeks following MS Ignite, the Message Center communications - web UI, weekly digest, and new emails - will flag "Major Updates" so that admins can receive email notifications and know how long that capability will be in Targeted Release before reaching Standard Release. During Targeted Release (new name for First Release), the capability will be enabled for any tenant or user set to Targeted Release, and tenant admins can configure or disable the feature. Settings that are applied during Targeted Release carry forward to Standard Release so that you can comfortably prepare for new releases. For organizations that want to allow the evergreen service to update seamlessly, no action is required, and Major Update emails can be disabled.

title: Microsoft Bookings release in EDU subscriptions
description: Microsoft Bookings will be available in our current paid Office 365 Education subscriptions, A3 and A5.

title: Outlook for iOS & Android: Create and Manage Groups
description: We're bringing group creation and management to Outlook for iOS & Android. Users will be able to create/edit/delete a group and add/remove group members. This feature respects company policies set by administrators.

title: Praise on mobile - iOS
description: Users will now have the ability to praise their coworkers on Yammer through their mobile phones.

title: StaffHub: Terms and Conditions now available
description: Microsoft StaffHub will now support customer defined terms and conditions - helping to address application usage within Firstline Workers.

title: Mail tile change in Office 365 App launcher
description: We’re updating the Office 365 app launcher. With the new App launcher, the Mail tile will be renamed Outlook, functionality will not change. The Outlook tile will be pinned by default to your main view.

title: SharePoint Online: create news from SharePoint home in Office 365
description: User will be able to create a new news article directly from their SharePoint home page in Office 365. Once you click the "SharePoint" tile app in the Office 365 launcher, you'll see the new "Create news" button next to the "Create site" button. Click "Create news" and then chose from the right-hand fly out pane where you wish to publish the news article to, a team site or a communication site of your choice from the list of sites available to you. And then, write your new news article. Share your news :-).

title: SharePoint web part: File viewer
description: This web part is an update (+ name change) to the Document web part, and continues to support embedding Word, Excel and PPT. The updated web part now supports PDFs, 3D models, medical images (like dicom), SharePoint or OneDrive-stored videos and more. The File viewer web part supports all 270+ file types supported by the latest OneDrive viewer technology. Embedding files of almost any type onto a SharePoint page or news just became possible.

title: SharePoint web part: Image updates
description: You can easily add an image to a SharePoint page or news article, and now when you do, you can further edit (crop/zoom) it inline to fit the needs of your page/news and layout. And now, instead of uploading an image, you can search, find and apply images from Bing public domain gallery. And lastly, you can program images to come from a specific document library and can be shown as a gallery, updated as you add and remove images from that document library.

title: SharePoint web parts: large authoring toolbox
description: The SharePoint authoring toolbox gives you access to both web parts and section layouts as you design your pages and news, and add your content while in edit mode. To accommodate the growing list of web parts and section layouts, plus custom web parts you build and add into your Office 365 environment, we've enabled a better way to both categorize and search for what you're looking for - to enable you to create pages and news fast without stumbling through trying to find what you need.

title: Secure external sharing
description: With this update users will be able to share externally in a simple and secure way without the creation of a MSA (Microsoft Service Account). When sending secure links to recipients outside of your organization, those recipients will be sent an email message with a time-limited, single-use verification code when they open the link.

title: Sway Sharing to Specific Groups
description: Office 365 commercial users will be able to share their Sways with specific groups within their organization

title: SharePoint pages: page usage information
description: Gain insights into the use of your pages and news articles via number counts for views, likes and shares.

title: Fluent UI updates for Web
description: New Fluent UI design for OneDrive web allowing you to see shared activity along with icons to show new files and folders

title: Self service Migration tool kit
description: We are releasing our migration toolkit for self service users looking to migrate from share drives or several cloud based services to OneDrive on their own

title: Zip file support
description: In the OneDrive web view , users will now be able to look at the content in a zip file and choose which files to extract.

title: Outlook 2016 for Windows: Drag and drop emails into group mailbox
description: Groups in Outlook users can drag and drop their emails from their inbox to the group mailbox in Outlook 2016 for Windows.

title: Outlook Calendar: Option to block forwarding of meeting invites
description: Meeting organizers will have the option to prevent attendees from forwarding a meeting invitation. This option will be available only for users in Office 365. In the first release, the option to prevent forwarding will only be available when creating or editing meetings in Outlook on the web, but the option will become available in Outlook for Windows shortly after.

title: eDiscovery Legal Hold Notices
description: Issue and track legal hold notices and the responses received back from custodians for eDiscovery

title: Service Health Dashboard Update: Report an Outage (GA)
description: We're adding enhancements to the Service Health Dashboard in the Office 365 admin center: Tell us about issues—If you are impacted by an issue that is not showing up on your Service health dashboard, the Report an Outage feature will provide you with a quick and easy way to let us know.

title: Privileged access management in Office 365
description:
This ID is cancelled as a duplicate and is replaced by Roadmap ID 30549.   To help customers protect and control their sensitive data, and meet their compliance needs, new privileged access management capabilities in Office 365 provides an approval workflow that’s scoped to your high-risk tasks within Office 365.

Privileged access management in Office 365 was designed based on the principle of Zero Standing Access, which is how we run our own data centers at Microsoft through Lockbox and Customer Lockbox. With privileged access management in Office 365, access requests must be approved by an authorized set of approvers. Access is then time-bound for a limited duration -- often referred to as “Just-In-Time” (JIT) access. This level of rigor is how we manage administrative access privileges internally for Office 365 today.

title: Microsoft Stream: Enhanced analytics for videos
description: Support for viewer analytics / statistics at the video level. With ability to see a trend of unique visitors and total views for a video overtime, as well as which parts of a video were viewed most.

title: Microsoft Stream: Public APIs
description: Enable basic programmatic capabilities (upload, edit, fetch, display) for Microsoft Stream via APIs.

title: Microsoft Stream: Screen recording tool
description: Windows and Mac OS X tool for creating screen recording videos and uploading them automatically to Stream.

title: Service Health Dashboard Update: Language Translations
description: We're adding enhancements to the Service Health Dashboard in the Office 365 admin center: Customers will be able to view Service Health Dashboard posts in different languages.

title: Service Health Dashboard: Personalized Tenant Resolution
description: We're adding enhancements to the Service Health Dashboard in the Office 365 Admin Center: Customers will be notified of service issue (incidents/advisories) resolutions on individual tenant basis, rather than by groups of tenants.

title: Improved end user onboarding on Mobile
description: Includes more prominent scan entry point and user education to get the most out of the mobile app.

title: Azure Information Protection Government (compatible with GCC High and DoD)
description:
THE ESTIMATED DATE IS Q3 2018. The roadmap is currently displaying an incorrect date, we're working on fixing this. 

Microsoft Azure Information Protection helps you classify and label your data at the time of creation. Protection (encryption + authentication + use rights) can then be applied to sensitive data. Classification labels and protection are persistent, traveling with the data so that it’s identifiable and protected at all times – regardless of where it’s stored or with whom it’s shared.

title: Intune Government (compatible with GCC High and DoD)
description:
THE ESTIMATED DATE IS Q3 2018. The roadmap is currently displaying an incorrect date, we're working on fixing this. 

Intune is a cloud based service that helps enable your workforce to be productive while keeping your corporate data protected. With Intune, you can 1) manage the mobile devices your workforce uses to access company data, 2) manage the mobile apps your workforce uses, 3) protect your company information by helping to control the way your workforce accesses and shares it, and 4) ensure devices and apps are compliant with company security requirements.

title: live events in Yammer
description: Allow users to host and drive conversations through live townhall events, broadcasted directly on Yammer's feed using Stream.

title: Rich Text Formatting for Yammer
description: Users will be able to use rich text i.e. bullets, bold, lists, italics for all posts in addition to announcements.

title: Microsoft Teams: Team Templates
description: Ability to create and use team templates

title: FastTrack | Dropbox to OneDrive for Business Migration
description: FastTrack Center will offer file migration services from Dropbox to OneDrive for Business as a new benefit provided by the FastTrack Center. This migration service will be available to customers with 150+ seats of eligible Office 365 plans. Once available, please refer to the FastTrack benefit for Office 365to review eligibility details.

title: Microsoft Planner for GCC
description:
THE ESTIMATED DATE IS Q3 2018. The roadmap is currently displaying an incorrect date, we’re working on fixing this.

Microsoft Planner helps users efficiently organize their teamwork. Teams can create new plans, organize and assign tasks, set due dates and update status. Planner also offers the ability to attach documents to specific tasks, edit them together and have conversations around tasks. Planner’s visual dashboards and email notifications help keep everyone informed on the overall progress of their initiative. Planner will be available in Office 365 US Government Community (GCC) when it meets the compliance commitments of the offering.

title: Service Health Dashboard Update: User level details
description: We're adding enhancements to the Service Health Dashboard in the Office 365 admin center: Access user level details— You will also be able to access a full list of impacted users to enable you to drive more targeted communication and support.

title: Service Health Dashboard Update: Report an Outage (preview)
description:
We're adding enhancements to the Service Health Dashboard in the Office 365 admin center: 
Tell us about issues—If you are impacted by an issue that is not showing up on your Service health dashboard, the Report an Outage feature will provide you with a quick and easy way to let us know.

title: Service Health Dashboard Update: in product messaging
description: We're adding enhancements to the Service Health Dashboard in the Office 365 admin center:  In product messaging —The new Service health dashboard will enable you to make your end users aware of service incidents and inform them about possible workaround solutions through optional in product notifications.

title: Office 365 Cloud App Security – App Permission Alerts
description: Policies can be created to alert you that a user has granted an application permission to their Office 365 information

title: Use Flow to approve hub-site joins
description: Require an approval from a hub administrator before allowing other sites to be connected.

title: SharePoint: organizational news
description: Broadcast news and announcements across the organization. This is a set of features that will be released over the summer.

title: Privileged access management in Office 365
description:
New privileged access management capabilities in Office 365 provides an approval workflow that’s scoped to your high-risk tasks within Office 365.

Requests for access can be automatically or manually approved.  Either way, all the activity is logged and auditable, so that both privileged access requests and approvals can be reviewed and seamlessly provided for internal reviews and auditor requests.

title: Microsoft Secure Score localization
description: Secure Score will be localized in additional languages.

title: Office 365 Data Governance: File Plan Builder
description: Now use the file plan builder to set hierarchy for departments, locations and categories for records retention schedules.

title: Office 365 Data Governance: Deletion Report
description: Now you will have access the data deletion report for manually disposed records from EXO and SPO in the Reports tab of the Security and Compliance Center.

title: Advanced Data Governance: API for Event Based Retention
description: Now automate Event Based Retention using the Advanced Data Governance API to connect to other line of business applications and trigger retention and deletion policies based on certain events.

title: Advanced eDiscovery: Search & Tagging
description: Now you can use the new Search and Tagging capability in Advanced eDiscovery to search content within your existing Advanced eDiscovery case, including keywords, metadata and or additional Advanced eDiscovery analytics  such as Themes, Relevance score and tag them for organization. At export, you can then decide to export only content that has been tagged in a certain way.

title: Microsoft Secure Score support for new controls
description: Secure Score will add new controls to support Microsoft Cloud App Security, Azure Active Directory, Windows, and Office 365 Threat Intelligence.

title: Microsoft Secure Score support for new controls
description: Secure Score will add new controls to support Microsoft Teams, Azure Information Protection, SharePoint Tags, and Microsoft Dynamics

title: Exchange online PowerShell cmdlet to edit an Office 365 Group’s email addresses
description: This feature will let you update the email addresses (SMTP addresses and more) of an Office 365 Group that has already been created. This functionality is only available for admins and will be performed through an Exchange Online PowerShell cmdlet. The changes made to the email addresses will sync into Azure Active Directory as well.

title: Block Download in OneDrive
description: Users will be able to share a link to a file that prevents the recipient from downloading it (they can only view on the web).

title: Outlook for Android: View group events
description: Users will be able to view upcoming group events directly from the group's contact card.

title: Known Folder Move for ODB
description: Capability to move Known Folders to ODB. Includes support for initial account configuration as well as post deployment migration.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Option to change the default end time for meetings and appointments
description: Change the default end time for meetings and appointments by selecting an option to reduce the duration of your events.  Reducing the meeting time can give attendees scheduled time to get to their next meeting.  Calendar options included for meetings of less than and more than one hour.

title: Camera Upload for ODB
description: Automatically upload the photos you take on your Android or iOS device to OneDrive.

title: Admin tool :TeamSite auto-mount
description: Admins can specify TeamSite Libraries they want their users to sync

title: External Sharing Reports
description: Organization admins will be able to see all the files in a site that are shared externally.

title: Outlook for Windows:  Shared calendar improvements
description: Introducing a new service backed model for sharing calendars with other Office 365 subscribers that improves performance and reliability and keeps all calendars in sync.

title: Outlook on the web - block forwarding of meeting invites
description: When creating a meeting, the organizer can now choose to prevent attendees from forwarding the meeting invite.

title: Outlook on the web - option to show declined events
description: Outlook is adding an option to allow the user to show in their calendars the events they have declined.

title: Outlook on the web - option to cancel events from a date forward
description: Outlook now gives you more flexibility when managing recurring series. Users will be able to edit or cancel a recurring series starting on a date, without affecting past events in the series.

title: Outlook on the web - hide attendee list
description: When creating a meeting, the organizer can now choose to hide the attendee list from attendees, similar to BCC’ing someone in an email

title: SharePoint: site activity shows group inbox activity
description: Beyond important site activities, like files modifications and published news, now you will see additional important email activity that’s happening in the group inbox.

title: SharePoint mobile: new Find tab
description: What was three is now one, and it’s a super powerful, personal tab infused with AI. The new Find tab makes it the easiest way ever to connect with expertise and knowledge across your organization. It brings a best-in-class mobile search experience, with an intelligent understanding of what you work on, how you work, and how your colleagues’ work relates to you. The new Find tab collapses Sites, Links, People and Search into one, streamlined experience. It, too, is where you will find quick answers, notifications, sites, people and more – in an efficient, tailored flow of what you’re looking for, even before you go looking. The Find tab, coming to the SharePoint mobile app, uses AI to help you find people, content, and answers to your questions while on the go.

title: SharePoint organizational news: audience targeting
description: You can better define what news articles and pages appear on the home experience of your site by configuring what is visible to specific groups. Each person will have a unique experience that complies with what you wish them to view without creating multiple audience-specific sites, you can serve them all from within a more centralized location with a personalized, targeted experience. Audience targeting support will be enabled in news, pages and other web parts so that you can define and target who best to reach with content and site experiences. You will be able to control how pages and parts of pages appear to different people ad groups. This example shows a web part with tailor content by group permissions.

title: Live event broadcasting capability in Microsoft Stream
description: Live event broadcasting is now available in Microsoft Stream.  Host and watch live broadcasts in Stream, or watch them in Yammer and Teams.

title: Copy of: Exchange Hybrid Configuration Wizard - Organization Config Transfer Phase 2
description:
In addition to copying new objects from on-premises to cloud, the admins will be giving a choice to update existing objects in cloud if the attribute values are different from on-premises. 

Four additional objects – OrganizationConfig, DlpPolicy, ActiveSyncDeviceAccessRule and ActiveSyncOrganizationSettings are included in the scope of the feature.

title: Outlook for Android: Likes and Reactions
description: Ability to like or react (add emotions) in response to a email. Those like and reactions will appear in other Outlook apps.
